loans.name: Habibatou

texts.fr: Madame Habibatou  est une femme mariée de 36 ans. Ella 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 7 et 14 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis 2000 et gère une cantine dans un marché de la place. C’est dans le souci de lutter contre l’oisiveté   qu’elle a choisi cette activité. Aussi c’est une activité qu’elle aime beaucoup. Les périodes les plus favorables  pour  son activité sont les veilles de fêtes de tabaski et de korité. Elle est sociétaire de L'U-IMCEC depuis aout 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs dans l’intention de renforcer son fond de roulement ce qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en marchandises pour mieux rentabiliser sa cantine. Plus précisément le prêt sera destiné a l’achat de tissus et d’habits prêts  a porter dans le but de pouvoir répondre  a la forte demande de veille de fête de korité. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux développer son activité, augmenter ses bénéfices   pour satisfaire elle-même ses besoins personnels et éviter la dépendance vis-à-vis de son mari.
texts.en:
Madame Habibatou  is a married woman of 36. She has four children whose ages vary between seven and 14. She has been in business since 2000 and manages a shop in a local marketplace. She does this so as not to remain idle. Also, it is an activity she likes a lot. 

The most favorable period for her business is the days just before the (Muslim) feast days of Tabaski and Korité. She has been a member of the branch at Yoff since August 2010. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs in order to bolster her working capital which will allow her to buy merchandise so as to make her little shop profitable. 

More precisely, the loan will be used to buy cloth and ready-to-wear clothing so that she can be ready for the unusually great demand just before the Korité feast day. This loan will allow her to better develop her business and increase her profits so that she can be responsible for her own expenses and not be dependent on her husband. .

loans.use: to buy cloth and ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dieyla

texts.fr: Madame Dieyla est une femme mariée de 41 ans qui habite dans le banlieue d'une grande ville en Senegal. Elle gère 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 et 15 ans. Elle est couturière de profession depuis le bas âge.  Actuellement elle s’active plus sur l’aviculture car pour elle c’est la ou elle tire plus de profits. Elle a choisi son activité de couture sous l’influence de son oncle. Dieyla est sociétaire de l'UIMCEC depuis juillet 2007. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poussins. son objectif est de développer son activité d’aviculture pour augmenter ses revenus financiers afin de pouvoir satisfaire ses besoins personnels.
texts.en: Mrs. Dieyla is a married 41-year-old who lives in the suburbs of a big city in Senegal.  She cares for three children between 7 and 15 years old.  She has been a tailor by profession since she was very young, having chosen tailoring through her uncle’s influence.  Currently she is more involved in raising poultry since she can make more money in that business.  Dieyla has been an account holder at Yoff since July 2007.  She is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs to buy chicks.  Her goal is to develop her poultry business in order to earn more money and meet her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Younoussa

texts.fr: Monsieur Younoussa habite au sénégal. Il est âgé  de 52 ans et exerce l’activité de commerçant depuis 2000. Il faisait la couture avant de disposer d’une boutique qu’il gère actuellement. Il a choisi cette activité par amour, et cette dernière lui procure une rentabilité très positive pendant la période de chaleur.. Younoussa  est membre du guichet de l'U-IMCEC depuis juin 2005. Il y a déjà contracté 3 prêts  antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs  prévu pour  l’achat de denrées alimentaires dans le but de renforcer  son stock de produit dans la boutique. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’augmenter ses profits et de mieux gérer l’entretien de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr Younoussa is 52 years old and lives in Senegal. He has been a shopkeeper since 2000, and before this used to work as a tailor- now he manages the tailor shop. He chose shopkeeping out of fondness for the trade, but the tailor's generates steady revenues during the hot period. Younoussa has been a member of UIMCEC since 2005 and has already taken out 3 loans with them. He is now seeking a 300,000 FRS loan in order to purchase foodstuffs so he can boost his store's stock levels. This financing will enable him to boost his profits and better see to his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man living alone. He has eight years of experience working as a music recorder. In 2005, he opened his own studio and started to sell the best recorded CDs. In addition, he rents musical tools and instruments to be used in special events and occasions such as weddings. With his requested loan of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase new musical instrument needed. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new tools needed for his business

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a single woman who lives at a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the extended family.

For the past two years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable operators in the area. She dreams of increasing her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase crates of tomatoes, bananas, onions and green vegetables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase crates of tomatoes, bananas, onions and green vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate her rental houses and pay laborers.

loans.name: Mavludakhon

texts.ru:
Мавлудахон активная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведенная и любящая мать 2детей. Она одна работает в семье и ей надо обеспечивать все потребности своих детей. Она каждый день усердно работает, чтобы получить хороший прибыль. Она решила заняться торговлей. Она покупает и реализует мужских халатов. У неё достаточно много клиентов и с легкостью продает свой товар.  Прибыль,  которое она получила из данного бизнеса, она покупала автомашину. Мавлудахон хотела бы получит кредит в размере 1300$ США для покупки мужских халатов с целью расширение бизнеса. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mavludakhon is an active and industrious woman. She is divorced and the loving mother of two children. She is the only one who works in the family, and she has to provide for all the needs of her children. She works hard every day to make a decent profit. She decided to work in trade. She buys and sells men's coats. She has a lot of clients and can easily sell her goods. She bought a car with the profit which she made from the business. Mavludakhon would like to receive a loan of U.S. $ 1300 to buy men's dressing gowns in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 28-year-old married man from Lebanon living with his wife. He is the only income source for his family. He has been involved in the agriculture field for the past five years. In 2008, he invested in purchasing land where he started to cultivate all types of vegetables. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional agricultural tools and supplies. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his business operation and start cultivating fruits.

loans.use: to purchase additional agricultural tools and supplies

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is the main owner of a plot of land. His job consists of cultivating different types of vegetables such as peas, beans etc… Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase pesticides and seeds in order to increase his business productivity. He has one part-time employee helping him with the work and hopes to be able to further expand his business so that he can provide this employee with a full-time job.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Medonald

texts.en: Medonald is 22 years old. She has two children. One of her children is in school. She is a married woman. She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She will use the profit from her business to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase more breads and cake to sell

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 31-year-old Lebanese single man living independently. He has 10 years of experience working with mobile phones. In 2006, this man was able to open his own communication and mobile phone shop. He sells a wide range of mobile phones and their accessories. 

With his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will increase his purchases of new phone accessories. His main purpose is to insure his customer’s needs are satisfied. This will be his first Kiva loan and he is sure that it will help him increase his business sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to increase his purchases of new phone accessories.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeanette has been a rice farmer for the past 20 years, having learned the trade from her parents. She is married, has six children and is applying for a loan to help plant her next rice crop. She will use the money to pay for nursery services, transplanting, field management, guarding birds and harvesting.
She will use the profits to expand her business by buying machinery to further increase her output. 

Agriculture accounts for 37 percent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 percent of Rwanda's export revenue and employs about 90 percent of Rwanda's people (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwanda, financial institutions view lending to farms as a high-risk proposition because profitability is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to help fund the production of her next rice crop.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and one school-aged child. He has been working as a mechanic for the past eight years. In 2007, he opened his own garage. He is specialized in repairing car body-work. He is the main income provider of the family. 

With his requested loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase mechanicA. tools and supplies. He has stated that the loan will help him increase his profits by 10%. He is very positive and hopes to be able to better support his family financially.

loans.use: to purchase mechanical tools and supplies.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is a rice farmer who is a widow with four children.  She has been a farmer for the past nine years, and she learned rice farming from her parents.

She will use her Kiva loan to cover labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding from birds, and then in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production.

texts.en:
Betty is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is divorced and has five children.  Four of her children are currently in school.  Betty has a poultry farm business, which she has had for three years.         
	
To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Betty hopes to expand her business. Betty is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her poultry business.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jennifer hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Jennifer hopes to expand her business. Jennifer is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a rice farmer who is married with two children. His children are not yet in school. He has been a farmer for the past eight years and he learned rice farming from his parents.

He will use his Kiva loan to support the labor costs of his rice production such as nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay for labor costs for his rice production

loans.name: Emmanuel

He will use his Kiva loan to pay for labor costs during rice production such as nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

loans.use: To pay for the labor costs of his rice production

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

texts.en:
Innocent has been working as a Rwandan rice farmer for the past six years.  He belongs to the EFFS CoopRice farmers, and he learned farming from the cooperative.

He will use his Kiva loan to cover labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and then in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 28 years old. She has five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a married woman. Flora sells groundnuts. She has been in this business for one year. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that she will use the profits from her business to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien has been a Rwandan rice farmer for the past two years and was trained by his COOP (cooperative).

He will use his Kiva loan to cover labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and then in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been a rice farmer for the past eight years. He is married with four children and learned rice farming from training within his cooperative.

He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and then in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Avelardo

texts.es: El joven Avelardo vive en un pueblo que se caracteriza por ser de clima frio templado donde hay muchas montañas con muchos arboles frutales,el tiene 20 años de edad, el es soltero, vende plantas de aguacate, el solicito su préstamo para comprar bolsas, abono y fertilizantes para sus plantas de aguacate, el inicio su negocio hace un año el terreno es propio aprendió entrando a trabajar en los viveros ahí le enseñaron a cultivar las plantas, le hecho muchas ganas a su trabajo para aprender todo lo relacionado a sembrar plantas en especial el aguacate, estas plantas se venden mucho ya que hay varias personas que tienen sus huertas de aguacate, su negocio es importante por las ganancias que le deja le permite seguir invirtiendo, el se siente orgulloso cuando vende todas sus plantas son de buena  la calidad, el trabaja con muchas ganas pone todo corazón y empeño en la siembra de las plantas su hermano le ayuda en el cultivo de las plantas de aguacate, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son las plagas, el clima, las eladadas de diciembre queman las plantas, sus sueños y esperanzas son vivir bien y que tenga mucha producción de plantas. El quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos y que sigan ayudando a las personas que quieren crecer en sus negocios y vivir mejor con sus familias".
texts.en: Young Avelardo lives in a town characterized by its cold temperate climate where there are many mountains with many fruit trees. He is 20 years old, single and sells avocado plants. He is requesting this loan to buy bags, manure and fertilizers for his avocado plants. He started his business a year ago on his own land. He learned by starting to work in nurseries, where he learned to cultivate the plants. He worked eagerly in order to learn everything related to growing plants, especially avocados. These plants sell a lot since there are various people that have avocado orchards. His business is important because of the profits that allow him to continue investing. He feels proud selling; all his plants are of good quality.  He works with much enthusiasm, putting his whole heart and all his effort into the cultivation of the plants. His brother helps him with the cultivation of the avocado plans. The challenges his business faces are the pests, climate and December frosts that burn the plants. His dreams and hopes are to live well and to have high production of his plants. He wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “Thank you for your loans, and continue helping people that want to grow their business and live better with their families.”

loans.use: to buy bags, manure and fertilizers for his cultivation of avocado plants.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es: La joven Wendy tiene 19 años de edad, su localidad es de clima templado hay mucha vegetacion y muchos arboles se da el aguacate y el durazno, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de la secundaria, ella es casada no tiene hijos, ella va a iniciar su negocio de compra-venta de ganado, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar cerdos y alimento para engordarlos y venderlos, su esposo le va a enseñar cómo trabajar en este negocio para obtener beneficios y puedan construir su casa, sus sueños y esperanzas son tener su casa para ella y su esposo, ella está nerviosa y contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir por que va a poder iniciar su negocio le va a echar muchas ganas a trabajar en la engorda de los cerdos y espera en Dios le vaya bien en su negocio. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por su préstamos y que sigan ayudando a las personas a emprender su negocio y salir adelante junto con la familia”.
texts.en: Young Wendy is 19 years old. Her locality is of temperate climate and there is much vegetation and many trees that produce avocados and peaches. She studied up to the 3rd year of secondary school. She is married and has no children. She is going to start her business of buying and selling livestock. She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them and sell them. Her husband is going to teach her how to work in this business in order to obtain a profit and so they can build a house. Her hopes and dreams are to have a house for herself and her husband. She is nervous and happy with this loan that she will receive in order to be able to start her business. She will work eagerly in fattening the pigs and hopes in god that her business will go well. She wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “Thanks for your loans, and continue helping people start their businesses and get ahead together with their families.”

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: La joven Érika vive en un pueblo bonito de clima templado donde hay mucha vegetacion y arboles frutales, ella tiene 20 años de edad estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria, ella es casada su esposo es campesino, ellos tienen un hijo varón de año y medio de edad, ella va a iniciar su negocio de siembra y venta de plantas de aguacate, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar plantas de aguacate y surtir su negocio, su suegra y su esposo le van a enseñar a cultivar las plantas de aguacate, este negocio es importante para ella porque va a tener trabajo y dinero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, las ganancias del negocio las pieza utilizar una parte para la comida y otra parte para invertir en bolsas y huesos de aguacate para sembrar y crezca su producción de plantas de aguacate, sus sueños y esperanza son seguir vendiendo plantas de aguacate, que se dé bien la producción de las plantas y que su pequeño hijo este bien de salud y siga creciendo. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamos nos ayuda a tener nuestro propio negocio".
texts.en: Young Érika lives in a pretty town of temperate climate where there is much vegetation and many fruit trees. She is 20 years old and studied until the 6th grade. She is married and her husband is a peasant. They have a boy who is one and a half years old. She is going to start her business of cultivating and selling avocado plants. She is requesting this loan to buy avocado plants and supply her business. Her mother-in-law and husband are going to teach her to cultivate the avocado plants. This business is important for her, because she will have work and money to help her husband with the household expenses. She plans to use part of the profits from the business for food and invest the other part in bags and avocado pits to sow and grow her avocado plant production. Her hopes and dreams are to continue selling avocado plants, that her plant production goes well and that her son is healthy and continues growing. She wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “Thank you very much for the loans that help us to have our own business.”

loans.use: to buy avocado plants.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: El Joven Israel vive en un lugar donde el clima es templado, hay muchos arboles frutales y mucha vegetacion, el tiene 25 años de edad, el estudio hasta el 2º. Año de secundaria, el es casado no tiene hijos, el vende plantas de aguacate, el solicito su préstamo para comprar bolsa, plantas, abono para surtir su negocio, el inicio su negocio hace 2 años con sus ahorros de su trabajo anterior también ahí aprendió todo lo relacionado a la siembra de las plantas de aguacate, este negocio es bueno porque donde el vive siembran mucho el aguacate, las personas que tienes huertos de aguacate le compran sus productos, el sale a vender sus plantas a las plazas y también llegan a su casa a comprar las plantas, su negocio es importante es un trabajo bonito donde adquiere ingresos para la familia y puede darle empleo a otras personas, el se siente orgulloso cuando vende sus plantas y tiene ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia y de echarle ganas a su trabajo para salir adelante, el utiliza las ganancias comprando mas plantas para tener para vender, el está muy contento con su préstamo que va a recibir lo va a utilizar para surtirse de los materiales para sembrar mas plantas de aguacate. El quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “estoy muy agradecido con ustedes por el apoyo que me están dando la oportunidad de salir adelante en mi negocio”
texts.en:
Israel is a young person who lives in a place where the climate is temperate and there are many fruit trees and vegetation.  He is 25 years old and studied until the second year of high school.  He is married and has no children.  He sells avocado plants.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase bags, plants, and fertilizer to improve his business.  He started his business two years ago with his savings from his last job, where he learned everything about planting avocado plants.  This is a good business because the area where he lives is good for planting avocado.  People who have avocado orchards purchase his products.  He also goes out to sell his plants in the plaza and they also come to his house to purchase plants.  

His business is important.  It is a good job where he earns income for his family and he can employ other people.  He feels proud when he sells his plants and he has income to get his family ahead and he can improve his business.  He uses his earnings to purchase more plants to sell.  

He is very happy with the loan he will receive.  He will use it to stock up on the materials needed to plant more avocado plants.  He wants to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "I am very thankful to you for the support that is giving me the opportunity to succeed with my business."

loans.use: to purchase bags, avocado plants, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Leoba

texts.es: La señora Leoba tiene 46 años de edad ella estudio hasta el 5º. Año de primaria, ella es viuda tiene 7 hijos todos son mayores de edad, ella vive en un pueblo bonito de clima templado, el paisaje es con mucho follaje y árboles frutales se da el aguacate, el durazno, ella vende plantas de aguacate en las plazas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar plantas, bolsas y abono para su siembra de plantas de aguacate, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años su hijo compro las plantas y le enseño a cultivar las plantas de aguacate, es un negocio importante porque le da ingresos para la comida y para las inscripciones de sus hijos en la escuela, su negocio es muy conocido se traslada en su camioneta a las plazas a vender sus plantas ahi llegan a comprar las plantas las personas que tienen sus huertas de aguacate y venden los aguacates, las ganancias de su negocio las vuelve a invertir en bolsas, huesos de aguacate para sembrar y tener más plantas, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir se va a surtir de plantas y materiales para incrementar su negocio. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamo nos echan la mano para seguir trabajando en nuestros negocios”.  Ella desea lo mejor para sus hijos, que estén bien y que vivan contentos”.
texts.en: Leoba is 46 and studied up to the 5th grade.  She is a widow and has 7 children, who are now adults.  She lives in a lush, fertile region wherer trees such as avocado, peach and others grow well.  She sells avocado plants in public plazas, and now seeks this credit to buy avocado plants, bags and fertilizer to support her business.  Leoba started this business with her son two years ago.  Her sales allow her to meet household expenses and also cover school fees.  She is well known in the community, and transports her plants in a pick up to public squares where her clientele buy her small trees for their home gardens.  She is confident that this loan will result in increased profits, return investment and a growing business.  Leoba thanks Kiva and Fundación Realidad for assisting borrowers in achieving success in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy avocado plants, bags and fertilizer

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima, vive en una localidad lejana en donde las personas se dedican a sembrar milpas, frijol, chayotes  y es un lugar muy bonito donde hay árboles muy grandes.

    Ella se dedica  a la compra  de de pavos  chicos engordarlo para después venderlo en la misma localidad y en ello lleva trabajando hace cinco años y once meses  y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un mejor ingreso para su hogar.

     o que lo motivo a dedicarse  a esta actividad fue su esposo quien lo insistió  que juntos trabajen para mejorar su calidad de vida  y así poder salir adelante.

     Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo solicitado y su actividad pueda ahorrar para comprar algunas cosas que le hace falta en su hogar.
texts.en:
Máxima lives in a remote area where people work planting corn fields, beans, and chayote.  It is a beautiful place where there are very big trees.  

She works purchasing young turkeys to fatten and later sell in the same place.  She has done this work for five years and eleven months, and says that it is going very well since she has had a better income for her home.

She was motivated to start this work by her husband, who insisted that they work together to improve their quality of life so that they could get ahead.  

She hopes that with the loan requested and her business, she can save to purchase a few things that she needs for her home.

loans.use: to purchase feed to raise turkeys.

loans.name: Clive Road Women's Group 3

texts.en:
Everybody wants to have a settled means of subsistence. Those who find pleasure in a life where they have to live by their wits are many but given a choice, they would go with something that helps them to bring value and mileage to their lives. 

Twelve years ago is when 38-year-old mother of four,  Prossy, made the decision to take root in her fish sales business in Jinja. Jinja is the source of the Nile River and many indigenous people have taken to fishing and fish selling as their source of livelihood. 

Prossy joined the fish sales business with no prior business experience but under the financial auspices of her husband. She has sustained her business through thick and thin with grit, tenacity and unwavering diligence. This explains her longevity in this competitive business.

On the side, she also runs a modest food sales business.  Weekly she says this business generates sales profits totaling Uganda shillings 100,000. Prossy says she intends to use this Kiva loan to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos a la señora Yuliana que nació en la ciudad de Cusco, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades económicas, Yo trabajo en una agencia de viajes de mi hermano Eduardo y mis funciones es recoger turistas del aeropuerto y después los llevo a sus hoteles. Ya son dos años que me dedico a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiero el préstamo para comprar boletos turísticos. Mi sueño es tener mi propia agencia de viajes”.
texts.en:
The community bank Vamos Juntas meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco, Perú.  Cusco is known as a popular tourist area for its traditional festival of Inti Raymi and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is found there.  

In this place, we meet Yuliana, who was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  

She says, "Currently, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I do my work.  I work at my brother Eduardo's travel agency and my job is to pick up tourists at the airport and then bring them to their hotels.  I have been doing this work for two years and it is going very well.  I am asking for this loan to purchase package tours.  My dream is to have my own travel agency."

loans.use: to purchase package tours.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María del Rosario, es de un lugar bonito, en donde celebran la fiesta del señor san Pedro ya que es el patrón del pueblo, ella es cada con el señor  Bernardo y con quien procreo  tres hijos que aun que están su responsabilidad.-

    Ella solito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de gallinas ponedoras y después  vender lo  huevo en la misma localidad, en donde lleva cinco años y cometa que ele va bien ya que con ello a tenido un buen ingreso en sub hogar.

    Lo que  lo motivo a esta actividad fue su propia creatividad para poyar a su esposo así juntos aportar con los  ingresos de la casa  y sacar adelante a su pequeña familia.
 
     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo pueda tener un mejor desarrollo económico  para así a seguir apoyando a sus hijos  a que sigan delante.
texts.en:
María del Rosario is from a beautiful place where they celebrate the feast of Saint Peter, who is the patron saint of the town.  She is married to Bernardo and they have three children who are still their responsibility.

She is asking for this loan to purchase laying hens and later sell the eggs at the same location.  She has done this work for five years, and she said that it is going well because she has had a good income.  

She was motivated to start this work by her own creativity to support her husband, so that they could both contribute to the household expenses and help their small family get ahead.  

She hopes that with her small business and this loan, she can have better economic development so that she can continue supporting her children.

loans.use: to purchase laying hens and later sell the eggs.

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
La señora María dora es casada con el señor Sergio  y con quien  procreo dos hijos que un están a su responsabilidad, ella vive en un lugar muy bonito en donde se cosechas  plátanos y frijol.

   Ella es las segunda vez que solita un préstamo y es para  invertirlo en la compra de pollos  para engordarlo y después venderlo  en donde lleva veintidós años y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello atenido un mejor  ingreso en su hogar. 

    Lo que motivo a esta actividad fue su familia para así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes están bajo su responsabilidad.

    Lo que más desea es que con  esta pequeña actividad  y el préstamo pueda mejorar su calidad de ingresos y así seguir trabajando para darles lo  más necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Dora is married to Sergio, and they have two children who are in their care.  She lives in a beautiful place where they raise bananas and beans.

This is the second time she has asked for a loan to purchase chickens to fatten and later sell.  She has done this work for 22 years and says it is going well since she has earned a better income.  

She was motivated to start this business by her family so that she could help her husband with the household expenses and improve the lives of their children who are in their care.

She hopes that with her small business and this loan, she can improve her income and continue working to give her children what they need.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia, es casada con el señor Rey David y con quien procreo dos hijos quienes ya están casados.

   Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  de cocos y venderle el agua, en la misma localidad en ello lleva  ocho años y ocho meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello saco adelante a sus dos hijos que afortunadamente ya están casados.

    Lo que lo inspiro en  este tipo de negocio fue su familia para que mejorar su ingreso en su hogar y así también apoyar asu esposo quien es el que se encarga de vender en el pueblo, mientras ella vende tamales  así juntos  trabajar el préstamo y poder pagarlo puntualmente.

    Lo que más desea de su actividad es  que siga trabajando para tener ahorros y con ello depender en la compra de su medicamento que les receta el doctor e su trata miento.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia and her husband, Sr. Rey David, have two grown children, both married. 

Antonia is applying for a loan to buy coconuts for a drinks business.  She has operated the business in the same place for eight years and eight months.  She says that she's happy the business has been successful because her earnings have given her children a leg up in the world.

Antonia started the business for her family because they needed the extra income.  Her husband sells what they make in the town and she sells tamales.  They will work together to repay the loan.

Antonia wants to continue working and saving.  She needs money for medicines that her doctor has prescribed for an illness.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her soft drinks business.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, es de una colonia muy bonita y su gente es muy trabajadora, ella es casada con el señor Juan diego y con quien procreo cinco hijos quienes dos ya están casados y tres aun están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes para  la elaboración de insumos para la elaboración de antojitos, como son: tamales, tacos, empanadas, entre otro y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a tenido un buen ingreso en su hogar.

Quien lo inspiro en esta actividad fue sus familia ya que ella tiene unos hermanos quienes viven fuera de la localidad y ellos también lo animaron a  que tenga una actividad en la que se pueda apoyar con sus ingresos en su hogar.

     Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo ella pueda tener un mejor ingresó para construir un local en donde exhibir su actividad y sus clientes le compren con más gusto.
texts.en:
Sra. Elizabeth lives in a very pretty town.  The people there are hard-working.  She and her husband, Sr. Juan, have five children, two of whom are grown.  The other three still live at home. 

Elizabeth is applying for a loan to buy supplies for her food business: tamales, tacos, empanadas,  She is pleased with the business and says that it has increased the family income.

Elizabeth started the business for her family.  Some of her siblings who live in other towns encouraged the idea as a means of bringing in extra income.  

Elizabeth wants to increase her income so that she can build a shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married with six children.  She has been a farmer for the past 10 years, and she learned rice farming from a formal training program.

She will use her Kiva loan to cover labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding against birds, and finally in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To cover labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
This is Manuel's first loan from both Fundación Alternativa and from Kiva. He will use the loan to buy building materials for the construction of his home. Manuel is a true beneficiary of micro-credit. He says that "because of their social condition, in the past his family wasn't able to apply for credit from traditional banks" and was therefore unable to improve their standard of living. He's extremely glad to be taking out his first loan from Fundación Alternativa and Kiva, and plans to repay his loan so that he can establish a good credit history and have access to larger amounts in the future.

Manuel lives and works in San Francisco de Quito, the capital city of Ecuador. Most commonly called Quito, the city is also known as “The Light of America” because it was the site of the first uprising against the Spanish and as the “Middle of the World,” because it straddles the equator. Quito is famous for the nearby active volcano Pichincha, its soaring altitude of 9,200 feet, and its beautiful downtown historical district, declared the first UNESCO Heritage Site in 1978.

Manuel is a hard-working 40-year-old entrepreneur. He lives with his two daughters and wife Maria (his younger daughter is in the above photo). For two years, Manuel has sold scrap-metal for a living. The entire family helps out with Manuel's scrap-metal business. He and Maria both are engaged in the work and occasionally his daughters help him with pick-ups. He's extremely busy in Quito, working 8 hours a day, Monday through Friday, and gathering the many disposable items that people leave on the street. He learned the business of selling scrap metal from former co-workers when he was a docksman (longshoreman).

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build his home.

loans.name: Edali

texts.es:
La señora Edali, tiene veinticuatro años de edad, ella vive en una colonia que es esta cerca del pueblo en donde las personas se dedican al trabajo del campo, es casad con el señor Roberclein y aun no tienen hijos.

    Ella se dedica a su hogar y solito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de elotes para venderlo hervido, en la misma localidad e donde lleva dos años y dos meses y cometa que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un mejor ingresos en su hogar.

    Quien  lo inspiro en  esta actividad fue su esposo para que juntos trabajen y así logren tener sus propios ingresos, para mejorar su estado económico.

     Lo que ella quisiera es poder comprar una carretilla para seguir vendiendo y así lograr incrementar sus ganancias, para comprar materiales que le hacen falta y comenzara  construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Edali, 24, lives in a rural area where local people make their living from farming.  She and her husband, Sr. Roberclein, don't yet have children.  

Edali is applying for a loan to buy corn that she will boil and then sell.  She has operated the business in the same place for two years and two months and says that she is pleased with it because it's brought in extra income.

Edali's husband encouraged her to start the business so that they would have a business of their own and could improve their standard of living.  

Edali wants to buy a food stall for the business and go on increasing her income.  She would like to buy the things she lacks and start building a house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora virginio avive en una colonia que esta a media hora del pueblo y es un lugar muy bonito en donde celebran la fiesta de la virgen de Guadalupe el doce de diciembre  y es muy alegre, ella es casada con el señor Eusebio y con quien procreo dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

      Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de frutas y legumbres en donde  a un comenzar con esta actividad y desea que le baya bien ya que con ello cuenta para mejorar sus ingresos de su hogar.

     Quien lo inspiro a ello fue su familia que aun  que pequeña  desea darle lo más necesario para a un así también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja de albañil y le va bien.

      Lo que más  desea es que con esta actividad pueda trabajar y así incrementar día con día su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginio lives in a rural area half an hour from the town.  It's a pretty place known for its Virgen de Guadalupe celebration every December.  Virginio and her husband, Sr. Eusebio, have two children, both still living at home.  

Virginio is applying for a loan to buy merchandise for her fruit and vegetable business.  It's a new business and she hopes that the extra income will help her family.

Virginio is starting the business to help her family.  She wants to help her husband, a construction worker, provide for their young family.  

Virginio wants the chance to work and contribute to her family's well-being.

loans.use: to stock her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina es originaria de una localidad llena de cultura ya que muy cerca de su casa se encuentra la zona arqueológica y también se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca. Cata como es conocida en su localidad tiene 35 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto año de primaria y que ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios porque sus papas eran personas de bajos recursos y no tenían dinero para comprarle las libretas. Doña Cata se dedica a la venta de dulces y frituras desde hace 6 años, dice que ella esta pidió el préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en la compra de dulces de diferentes sabores, chicharrones, sopas instantáneas, café, te, chicharrones preparados, refrescos, jugos y un poco de abarrotes ya que ese ha sido su sueño hacer una tienda de abarrotes. También tiene en su local unas maquinitas de juego de video donde los niños de su localidad van a divertirse un rato. Dice que decidió emprendes el negocio para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su casa y también porque se quería sentir útil. Ella surte en diferentes tiendas de la población de Zitacuaro, la meta que tiene Catalina es seguir invirtiendo en abarrotes ya que dice que es un buen negocio y se le gana muy bien a los productos pero sin descuidar su negocio de los dulces ya que el local que tiene en su casa es muy amplio. Doña Catalina esta casada con el señor Juan el cual es chofer de transporte publico, ellos no tienen hijos pero el sueño de doña Catalina seria tener un bebe.
texts.en: Catalina is from a town rich in culture.  The archeological sites near her house are well known and there's also a butterfly sanctuary.  Cata, as she is know, is 35 years old.  She left school after the sixth grade because her family didn't have enough money for her to continue.  Dona Cata has operated a business buying and selling snacks and other merchandise for 6 years.  She is applying to Fundacion Realidad for a loan so that she can stock the business with merchandise that she will resell: fried snacks, instant soups, coffee, tea, soft drinks, juices, etc.  She wants to add a few grocery items because she wants to start a grocery business in the future.  She also has a few video games for the neighborhood kids.  She says that she decided to start the business to help her husband with household expenses.  She also wanted to do something that would make her feel useful.  She buys her stock from various stores in Zitacuaro.  Her goal is to continue building her grocery business because it's a good business and a profitable one.  She doesn't want to give up her snacks business, though, because she has enough space in her shop for both.  Dona Catalina and her husband, Sr. Juan, a bus driver, have no children but she would like to have a baby one day.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 300 kilograms of potatoes, 25 kilograms of corn and 50 kilograms of chemical fertilizer, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth, tiene la edad 49 de  años, está casada y vive con su hija y la mamá. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de maquinas de coser. Ella  cuenta con un local y pretende invertir la compra de maquinas de coser para darle un aprovechamiento al local. Ella quiere implantar un negocio de costuras para vender ropa en el mercado local y lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de venta de ropa y costurería en general. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yamileth is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her daughter and mother. She intends to buy a sewing machine with the loan. She has a locale and intends to buy sewing machines to take advantage of it. She wants to open a seamstress business to sell clothes in the local market and in other areas. She wants to generate more income for her and her family's wellbeing as well as to grow her clothes selling and general sewing project. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans before in regular banks, but a FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with easier payments and much lower interest.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicken cages and begin to raise chickens.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina, es originaria de una localidad rica en cultura ya que muy cerca de ahí se encuentra localizada la zona arqueológica un lugar mágico lleno de energía positiva, ella tiene 47 años de edad y estudio hasta el segundo año de primaria y ya no continuo con sus estudios porque le ayudaba a trabajar a sus papas y no le alcanzaba para sus útiles que ocupaba en la escuela. Doña Cristina está pidiendo un préstamo a Financiera para la compra de leña, maíz, gas, cal, etc., ella se dedica a vender tortillas hechas a mano y a la venta de masa en su casa desde hace dos años y medio y comenta que empezó con este negocio para sacar adelante a sus pequeños hijos y para pagar los gastos de la casa. Cristina es Viuda y tiene 3 hijos estudiantes de primaria. La meta que tiene en mente es poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa ya que cerca de ahí no hay y mas adelante vender ropa y zapatos de segunda mano.
texts.en: Cristina is from a place that is rich in culture and very close to a magical archeological area full of positive energy. She is 47 years old and went to school until the second grade. She didn't continue with her schooling because she helped her parents work and there wasn't enough money for her school supplies. Cristina is asking for a loan to buy firewood, corn, gas, lime, etc. She sells handmade tortillas and tortilla dough in her house. She has done this for two years and tells us that she started this business to get her young children ahead and to pay the household expenses. Cristina is a widow and has 3 children in elementary school. The goal she has in mind is to open a small grocery store in her house since there isn't one nearby. IN the future, she wants to sell second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to sell handmade tortillas.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora cerca de su localidad hay un paraje turístico por sus ruinas arqueológicas y por que muy cerca se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca, ella esta casada con el señor Carlos ellos tienen un niño el cual estudia la primaria. Doña Lupita como de cariño le dicen sus amigos y familiares se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace seis años, comenta que emprendió su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella vende sus tortillas a sus vecinos, dice que un día antes pone su nixtamal a coser para al día siguiente llevar al molino el nixtamal para que lo muelan y hagan la masa e irse a hacer sus tortillas a su casa. Dice que hace dos veces al día tortillas en la mañana a las 8 horas y en la tarde a las 2 de la tarde para la hora de la comida. Ella pidió un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de maíz, cal, leña para hacer sus tortillas, también comenta que los fines de semana vende antojitos mexicanos por la noche como tostadas, pozole, tacos dorados, enchiladas etc. La meta que tiene doña Lupita es poner un puesto de antojitos mexicanos afuera de una primaria a diario para tener un poco mas de ganancias.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a very hard working woman.  Near her place is a tourist spot where there are archaeological ruins and nearby a Monarch butterfly sanctuary.  She is married to Señor Carlos and they have a son who is in primary school.  

Doña Lupita, as her friends affectionately call her, has been selling tortillas for six years.  She says she started her business to help her husband with household expenses. She sells her tortillas to her neighbors. She says the day before she cooks her nixtamal (corn treated with lime) for the following day, she takes it to the mill to be ground and made into dough so that she can return home to make her tortillas. She notes that she makes tortillas twice a day, in the morning at 8 a.m. and in the afternoon at 2 p.m., for mealtimes. 

She requested a loan from FRAC for the purchase of corn, lime and firewood to make her tortillas. She added that on weekends she also sells Mexican snacks at night like tostadas, pozole (hominy soup), tacos dorados (deep fried tacos), enchiladas, etc. Doña Lupita’s goal is to set up a stand selling Mexican snacks everyday outside a primary school  in order to earn a little more income.

loans.use: to sell homemade tortillas.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: La señora Amanda es originaria de una población muy rica en cultura ya que muy cerca de su localidad se encuentran unas ruinas arqueológicas que son la atracción de su población. Doña Amanda tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de dulces y frituras fuera de su casa desde hace 2 años y también vende cena fuera de su casa por las noches como tortas, quesadillas, enchiladas, tacos dorados y cada quince días hace pozole. Esta pidiendo un préstamo para la compra de dulces de diferentes sabores, chicharrones e insumos para elaborar la cena que vende. Doña Amanda es una mujer muy luchadora ya que es madre soltera de dos pequeños niños que estudian la primaria y ella esta trabajando muy duro para salir adelante con sus hijos. La meta que tiene Amanda es que sus hijos tengan una carrera ya que es la única herencia que ella les puede dejar.
texts.en:
Amanda is originally from a town that is very rich in culture because it is very close to the archeological ruins that are the town’s attraction.

Amanda, age 29, has been selling sweets and fried food outside of her house for two years.  She also sells dinner outside of her house in the evenings.  She sells dinners like sandwiches, quesadillas, enchiladas, and crispy tacos.  Every two weeks she makes “pozole” (a traditional soup).

She is requesting a loan to buy different flavors of sweets, “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds), and supplies to make the dinners that she sells.

Amanda is a very tenacious woman.  She is the single mother of two young children who are in elementary school.  She is working very hard in order to get her children ahead.  Amanda’s goal is for her children to have a career.  It it the only inheritance she is able to leave them.

loans.use: to sell Mexican street food and sweets.

loans.name: Manuel Angel

texts.es: Manuel Ángel, tiene la edad 53 de  años, está en unión libre y vive con su conyugue. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de insumos para su plantación de tomate. El cuenta con un terreno apto para la siembra de tomate y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un tomatal que de buena producción para vender un producto de calidad en el mercado local. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su conyugue y crecer con el proyecto del tomate. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Manuel Ángel, age 53, is in a common-law marriage and lives with his life partner.

He intends to use the loan to buy supplies for growing tomatoes.  He has a piece of land that is suitable for growing tomatoes.  He intends to invest in supplies like fertilizers and fungicides in order to get a better harvest.  He wants to establish a tomato field that produces well in order to sell a quality product at the local market.  

He wants to generate more income for the well-being of his life partner.  He also wants to grow with his tomato plan. 

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loan with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Norma Elena

texts.es:
La señora Norma Elena tiene la edad de 42 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casado con el señor Rolando que se dedica al trabajo del Operador de autobuces del palmar, ellos tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados y los otros dos tiene la edad de 16 años y 8 años que asisten a la preparatoria y primaria de su comunidad.
Ella nos platica que hacemos de 12 años con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo inicio a vender ropa para dama y caballero casa por casa con su amiga y vecinos de su comunidad poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo e inicio a salir a vender a otras comunidades como san Agustin, Tetela y Cosolapa. 
Ella a hecho cada dia mas clientes y hace algunos años inicia a vender tambien un poco de visuteria (accesorios para dama) y nos dice que Gracias a Dios se ha vendido muy bien. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, camisas, shorts, ropa interior, pantalones, calcetines, pulceras, aretes y bolsas de mano para posterior venta.
Ella espera que cada dia su negocio cresca mas ya que desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y en un futuro poco a poco construir un pequeño local en el cual vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Norma Elena, age 42, only went to high school.  She is married to Rolando, who works as bus operator in Palmar.  She has four children, and two of them are married.  The other two are 16 and 8 years old.  They go to high school and elementary school in their community.

She tells us that in order to help her husband, 12 years ago she started selling women’s and men’s clothes door to door to her friends and neighbors in her community.  Little by little her business was growing.  She started selling in other communities like Agustin, Tetela, and Cosolapa.  

She makes new customers every day, and some years ago she started to also sell a small amount of costume jewelry (accessories for women).  She says that thanks to God she has been selling very well.

She needs the loan to buy blouses, shirts, shorts, underwear, pants, socks, bracelets, earrings, and handbags to sell later.

She hopes that her business grows more every day. This is because she wishes to give her children a better quality of life and to gradually build a small place to sell her products in the future.

loans.use: to sell clothes.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Socorro tiene la edad de 52 años, estudio solo la primaria, esta casada con el señor Socorro que se dedica al trabajo del campo, ellos tuvieron 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y actualmente ya estan casados.
Doña Socorro nos platica que hace un poco mas de dos meses ella y su esposo ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de venta y realizacion de pan, ella nos platica que siempre habia querido tener su propio negocio e iniciaron a aprender a realizar el pan y hacer un pequeño ahorro para iniciar a trabajar y gracias a Dios ya ha abierto su pequeña panaderia.
Ella mps comenta que todos los dias desde el medio dia inicia la elaboracion del pan para por la tarde salir a vender con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, tambien nos platica que como no habia panaderia en su pueblo el pan se vende mucho y que en algunas ocasiones sus vecinos van a buscar el pan hasta su casa y ya no tiene que salir a vender. 
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de azucar, arina, leña, huevos, moldes y chochitos de colores para la elaboracion de su pan y posteriormente salir a vender su pan.
Ella espera que con este crredito su negocio cresca mas y tenga mas clientes para poder aumentar su venta y ganancia y asi poder ir mejorar el negocio poco a poco.
texts.en:
Socorro is 52 years old and studied only in primary school. She is married and her husband works in the countryside. They have 3 children who are now married adults.

Socorro tells us that just a little over 2 months ago, she and her husband began a small business baking and selling bread. She says that she had always wanted her own business and, consequently, she began to learn how to bake bread, obtaining a small oven to initiate the work. Thanks to God, Socorro has now opened a small bakery shop.

Socorro comments that every day at mid-day she begins to bake bread for the afternoon, then goes out to sell it to friends and neighbors in the community. She also says that there is no bakery in her town and, therefore, her goods sell well. Sometimes her neighbors come to her house in search of bread and she doesn't have to go out to sell.

Socorro needs this loan to invest in purchasing sugar, flour, firewood, eggs, bread molds, and colorful icing for baking her bread to sell in town.

Socorro hopes that with this loan, her business will expand and she can obtain more customers and augment sales and earnings and thus, be able to improve her business little by little.

loans.use: buy the necessary ingredients to bake and sell bread.

loans.name: Maria Basilisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Bacilisa tiene la edad de 61 años, estudio solo la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Jaime que trabaja de Jornalero, ellos tiene 4 hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados, uno trabaja y la mas pequeña tiene 14 años y asiste a la secundaria.
Ellas nos platica que desde muy pequeña su madre el enseño a realizar la pasta del mole de cuatro años inicio a realizar su pasta de mole y a vende casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad para ganar un poso mas de dinero ya que la situacion economica cada dia esta peor y asi poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella realiza su venta los dias lunes, martes y miercoles, tambien nos comenta que una vez a la semana realiza una venta de tamales.
Ella necesita esta credito para invertir en la compra de variedad de chiles, galletas, azucar, sal, semillas, platanos, chocolates, ajonjoli, aceite, tortillas, ajo, cebolla y tomates, para la elaboracion de la pasta del mole y posteriormente salir a venderlo. 
Doña Maria espera que con este credito su negocio prospere ya que desea poder dar mas educacion a su hija y poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Basilisa is 61.  She studied up to high school and is married to Jaime, who works as a newsagent.  They have 4 children, two of whom are already married; one other is working, and the youngest is a daughter of 14 who goes to high school.  

Her children tell us that from an early age, their mother taught them to make mole paste.  Four years ago, she started making her mole paste and selling it house to house to her friends and neighbors in the community to make a little extra money, since the economic situation gets worse every day, and this way she can help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesday, and she she also makes and sells tamales once a week.

Maria Basilisa needs this loan to invest in buying different types of chiles, biscuits, sugar, salt, pumpkin seeds, bananas, chocolates, sesame seeds, oil, tortillas, garlic, onions, and tomatoes to make the mole paste and then go out and sell it.

Doña Maria hopes this loan will help her business to prospser so she can support her daughter to get more education and so she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: sell mole and tamales.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
La señora Mari Cruz tiene la edad de 32 años, estudio solo la primaria y es madre soltera de dos hijas de 5 años de edad las cuales son gemelas y asisten al preescolar. 
Ella nos platica que como es madre soltera siempre ha tenido que trabajar pero hace un poco mas de un año y medio tomo un curso en su comunidad en el cual le enseñaron a trabajar en la elaboracion de pulseras, collares, aretes y anillos con piedras y como aprendio bien inicio a elaborar su visuteria y a vender con los amigos y vecinos de la comunidad y gracias a Dios las ventas han aumentado y cada dia tiene mas clientes, ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de hilos, cristal cortado, remaches, oro laminado, broches, separadores, cadenas y alfiles para la realizacion de su visuteria y posteriormente venderla.
Ella espera que casa dia su negocio prospere ya que desea dar a su hija una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro pueda estudiar una carrera.
Ella se encuentra muy agradecida por el credito que se le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
Mari Cruz is 32.  She has only an elementary-school education and is a single mother of two five-year-old twin girls, who are in preschool.  As a single mother, she has always had to work, but a little over a year and a half ago, she took a community course, where she learned to make bracelets, necklaces, earrings, and rings using stones.  Since she learned the trade well, she began to make her costume jewellery and sell it to friends and neighbors in the community. Her sales have been increasing, and she has more clients every day.

She needs this loan to invest in buying thread, cut crystal, clasps, gold wash, brooches, separators, chains, and pins to make her jewellery and then sell it.

She hopes her business will continue to prosper and wants to give her daughters a better quality of life and the ability to study for a career.  She is very grateful for the loan she is receiving.

loans.use: make and sell costume jewellery

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene la edad de 28 años, asistio a la escuela hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Esequiel que trabaja de chofer y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 7 y 6 años que estudian la primaria en su comunidad.
Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 3 años inicio a vender ropa de dama y caballero con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella realiza sus ventas casa por casa e inicio a vender comunidad y poco a poco como ha ido creciendo el negocio ha entrado a vender a otras comunidades como el Cedro y Ixtacap. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de ropa interior, vestidos, shorts para su posterior venta.
Ella espera que con esta invercion su negocio prospere ya que desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y continuar pagando sus estudios, tambien  nos platica que le gustaria a futuro construir un pequeño local en el cual venda sus productos.
Ella se encuentra muy agradecida por la confianza que la Fundacion le ha otorgado este prestamo.
texts.en:
Sandra is 28 years old, attended classes up to preparatory school, and is married to Esequiel, who works as a driver. They have 3 children, ages 8, 7, and 6, who study in primary school in the community.

Sandra tells us that just a little over 3 years ago, she began to sell ladies and mens clothing to friends and neighbors in her community. She sold door to door, beginning in her own community, then little by little, as her business grew, she began selling in other communities, such as Cedro and Ixtacap. Sandra needs this credit to invest in purchases of underwear, dresses, and shorts for future sales.

Sandra hopes that with this investment, her business will prosper, because she wants to offer her children a better quality of life, and to continue paying for their studies. She also wishes to construct a little shop in the future in which to sell her products.

Sandra is very grateful for the confidence that the Foundation has demonstrated in her by offering this loan.

loans.use: buy and sell clothing.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La joven Margarita tiene la edad de 19 años, estudio hasta el tercer semestre de preparatoria y es soltera, actualmente vive solo con su mama y nos platica que hace dos años cuando su papa murio ella tubo que ponerse a trabajar y dejar la escuela para poder sacar adelante a su mama asi que decidio abrir una pequeño negocio inicio vendiendo refrescos y galletas y poco a poco con sus ganancias, inicio a invertir en la compra de abarrotes y asi poco a poco ha logrado que su negocio continue creciendo.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, papel higenico, azucar, sal, regrescos, dulces y galletas para resurtir su negocio.
Ella dice que esta trabajando muy fuerte ya que desea en un futuro su tienda cresca mas y tenerla muy bien surtida para que sus clientes siempre encuentran lo que buscan y tambien poder sacar adelante a su madre.
texts.en:
Margarita is 19 years old.  She studied as far as the third semester of high school.  She is single and currently lives with her mother.  She tells us that two years ago, when her father died, she had to leave school and start working in order to support her mother.  So she decided to open a small business. 

She began by selling soft drinks and cookies, and little by little started to invest her profits in buying groceries.  In this way, little by little she has managed to keep her business growing. 

She needs this loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, toilet paper, sugar, salt, soft drinks, candy, and cookies in order to re-stock her business.  She says that she is working very hard, since she wants her business to grow even more in the future. She wants to keep it very well stocked so that her customers always find what they are looking for and so that she can support her mother.

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Elsa Rosa

texts.es: Elsa Rosa, tiene la edad 56 de  años, está separada y vive con sus hijos. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de maquinas para coser. Ella pretende invertir en la compra de maquinas de coser. Ella quiere implantar un negocio de costuras para vender ropa en el mercado local y lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus hijos y crecer con el proyecto de venta de ropa.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Elsa Rosa is 56 years old, is separated and lives with her children. With this loan she hopes to purchase sewing machines. She wants to establish a tailoring business to sell clothing in the local market and in neighboring locations. She wants to generate the greatest possible amount of income to ensure her well-being and that of her children and to grow her project selling clothing.

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. Before this loan she hadn't received any other loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR granted her this loan with much more ease and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Magdalena Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena Rocio tiene la edad de 49 años, estudio solo la secundaria, es vuida y tuvo dos hijos una mujer y un hombre los cuales ya estan casados y actualmente vive solita.
Doña Magdalena nos platica que ella siempre ha trabajado ya que le gusta ser una mujer muy activa y desde que vivia su esposo hace aproximadamente 8 años. Ella por las tardes vende chicharrones y rebanadas de sandia para ganar un poco de dinero extra con el tiempo inicio a vender un poco de abarrotes en el corredor de su casa y poco a poco como tuvo buena venta construyo un pequeño local en el frente de su casa en el cual continuo con su venta de abarrotes y llamo a su negocio "abarrotes Britani" y al fallecer su esposo no se quedo desprotegida ya que tenia un negocio con el cual salir adelante y a continuando trabajando en el.
Ella necesita este credito para invertir en la compra de leche, arroz, frijol, azucar, refresco, sal, galletas, dulces, cafe, queso, crema, jabon, cloro, detergente, papel de baño, producto enlatados, tomates, chiles y cebollas para resurtir su negocio. Ella nos dice que si negocio continua creciendo casa dia mas y que siempre le gusta tener el negocio muy surtido para brindar un servicio a sus clientes.

Ella se encuentra muy agradecida por la confianza que le da la Fundacion.
texts.en:
Magdalena Rocio is 49 years old.  In school, she only went as far as junior high.  She is a widow and has two children, a boy and a girl; both already married. Currently she lives alone.  

Magdalena tells us that she has always worked, since she likes to keep busy, especially since her husband died around 8 years ago.  In the afternoons she sold chicharrones (pork rinds) and slices of watermelon to earn a bit of extra money. Eventually, she began to sell a few groceries in the hallway of her home. Gradually, as sales were good, she built a small store in front of her house, where she continued selling groceries. She called her business "Abarrotes Britani" (Britani Groceries), and when her husband died, she wasn't left unprotected since she had a business to work in, that could enable her to get ahead in life.  

She needs this loan to buy milk, rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks, salt, cookies, candy, coffee, cheese, cream, soap, bleach, toilet paper, canned goods, tomatoes, chiles, and onions in order to re-stock her business.  She says that her business keeps growing every day and that she likes to keep it well-stocked in order to serve her customers.  She is very thankful for the confidence Fundación gives her.

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
María casada, su esposo agricultor, sus hijos estudiantes. Ella trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace tiempo, su proyecto mejorar la infraestructura de la casa, ha tenido dificultades ya que se ha enfermado. Ha realizado pequeñas mejoras.
Solicitad el préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción: cemento, arena, rejas, laminas de acero, pintura de aceite entre otros materiales para reparar el portón y el suelo de la entrara. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo a su seguridad y comodidad que obtendrá.
texts.en:
María is married. Her husband is a farmer and her children are students. She has worked for a private company for some time. Her project is to improve the infrastructure of her house. She has had some difficulties because she has been sick. She has already made some small improvements.

She requested this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, bars, steel sheeting and oil-based paint, among other materials. She will use the materials to repair her gate and the flooring in her entryway. 

She is grateful for this financing and for the support for the safety and comfort that she will have as a result.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Yaracet

texts.es:
La señora Yaracet tiene la edad de 25 años, estudio hasta tercer semestre de la preparatorio y esta casada con el señor Luis que trabaja de Jornalero, ellos tiene dos hijos de 6 años y otro de 8 meses  la mayor asiste a la primaria.
Ella nos platica que siempre habia tenido la inquietud de trabajar para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar pero apenas hace dos años inicio a vender ropa para dama y caballero casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.
Ella nos dice que le ha ido bien en el negocio y que quiere hacerlo crecer iniciando a vender zapatos po catalogo para tener mas clientes y que sus ganacias aumenten, asi poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro puedan sus hijos estudiar una profesion.
