Sra. Santa is 44 years old, married, and finished three years of her elementary school education. She has five children, none of whom are studying. Santa produces woven articles, specifically skirts. Santa was employed at another business and has 15 years of experience in this line of work. She has the support of her husband, who also works in the same trade.

Santa is requesting a loan to increase her operating capital so that she can buy fabrics for making more skirts. Over time, she hopes to have enough capital to establish her own business. The raw materials she will acquire become the base for generating more output, which will allow her to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for making woven skirts.

loans.name: Jannet Maribel

texts.es:
Jannet de 36 años es madre de familia, vive con su familia en casa de sus suegros, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Jannet se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos unos años, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes, también trae a pedido, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería y abastecer su negocio con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jannet is 36 years old and a mother.  She lives with her family in her in-law's home, which has full utility services.  It is located in the urban area of Chepén district, which is part of the department of La Libertad.  This area is characterized by its farming, livestock, and tourism.

Jannet works selling clothing; she has been running this business from her home for several years.  She sells merchandise to her customers, and also takes orders, thereby trying to have greater customer demand and so earn more income to cover her family's expenses.

On observing that her business was growing more prosperous on a daily basis, she felt it necessary to request a loan of 3,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan is to buy a greater quantity of merchandise and stock up her business with innovative products, with the goal that her customer base will continue to grow so she can pay back her loan and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to stock up her business.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: Carmela tiene 24 años, convive con Juan de 34 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Teresa del distrito de Pichari. Carmela es una joven con mucho entusiasmo  y creatividad, ella viene dedicándose a labrar la madera desde hace ya más de 5 años en sociedad con su esposo, quien es el motor de su familia. Los muebles que Carmela y su esposo realizan tienen mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes, pues los diseños que tiene son atractivos y a un bajo  precio. Carmela está a gusto con el trabajo que tiene, lo único que le aqueja es que no cuenta con las herramientas necesarias, aún le faltan algunos, es por tal motivo que recurre a MFP, para solicitar un crédito para poder realizar con mayor eficacia sus muebles. Este es su primer crédito MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1000 nuevos soles que solicita podrá comprar herramientas de carpintería.
texts.en:
Carmela is 24 years old and lives with Juan, age 34. They have two children. Carmela and her family live in their own house in the community of Teresa in the District of Pichari. She is a young woman with great enthusiasm and creativity. Carmela started working with wood more than five years ago along with her husband, who is the engine that drives their family. The furniture they produce is in great demand among their customers. Their designs are attractive and are offered for a low price. Carmela enjoys her work, but what irritates her is not having the necessary tools since she lacks a few items.

For this reason, she approached MFP to request a loan to help her become more efficient in producing her furniture. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to complete her payments on time. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy carpentry tools.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina de 30 años de edad, convive con jose de 33 años con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Josefina, recuerda aquellas tardes de su juventud en las que observaba a sus padres en como se debe cultivar un terreno agrícola, y de ahí en adelante se dedicó a esta actividad. Actualmente cultiva cacao, en ella aplica todas las técnicas que sus padres le enseñaron y con el apoyo de sus  hijos y el de su esposo cada temporada obtiene mejores cosechas. En el futuro ella tiene pensado abrir una tienda de abarrotes ya que por el barrio donde vive no una, y eso le daría mucha ventaja si emprende en este nuevo negocio. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que josefina reitera su compromiso en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles que solicita, contratará peones para que le ayuden a quitar la maleza entre sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Josefina is 30 years old and lives with Jose, age 33. They have two children. Josefina and her family live in their own home in the District of Pichari. She remembers the afternoons in her youth when she watched her parents cultivate their farm land. Now she engages in the same activity. Josefina currently grows cacao and utilizes all of the techniques she learned from her parents. With the help from her children and husband, she is able to obtain a better harvest each season. In the future, Josefina plans to open a grocery store because her neighborhood does not have one. Starting this new business will give her a great advantage.

This is her second loan with MFP. Josefina recommits to being prompt with her payments. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to hire workers to help with removing weeds from her cacao fields.

loans.use: to hire workers for removing weeds.

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es: Lusmila tiene 36 años, convive con Ernesto, su esposo y fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Lusmila a pesar de ser mujer,  se dedica en el negocio de venta de madera, actividad que lo realiza en compañía de su esposo. Pues en dicho trabajo encontró la estabilidad económica que buscaba, ahora puede cubrir los gastos estudiantiles de sus hijos. Por otro lado, también se dedica en la negociación y el traslado de la madera,mientras su esposo se encarga de sumnunistrarla,  que luego son repartidos por las carpinteria, quien le abastece a Lusmila de bloques de madera donde ella los reparte a las carpinterías del distrito de Pichari. En un futuro próximo Lusmila desea tener su propio local de expendio de bloques de madera en el distrito de Pichari para si de esta manera atender rápidamente a sus clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en realizar el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, comprará una cadena para su moto aserradora.
texts.en:
Lusmila is 36 years old and lives with her husband Ernesto and the fruit of their relationship, 3 children.  Together they live in their own house located in Pichari district.

Despite being a woman, Lusmila, together with her husband, runs a business selling wood. She found the economic stability she was looking for in this work and is now able to cover her children’s educational expenses. Lusmila sees to the transactions and transport involving wood, while her husband is in charge of supplying it. The wood is delivered for processing into blocks which are then supplied to Lusmila who distributes them to the carpenters in Pichari district. In the near future Lusmila wants to have her own shop for the sale of blocks of wood in Pichari district in order to more quickly take care of her customers. 

This is her first loan with MFP, which she is committed to repaying on time.  With the 1,500 soles that she is requesting, she will buy a chain for her motorized saw.

loans.use: to buy a chain for her motorized saw.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío de 35 años, convive con Yuri de 30 años de edad, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Rocío es una señora trabajadora, recuerda que antes de tener su botica , ofrecía sus medicamentos tocando puertas, trasladándose de un pueblo a otro, atendiendo a muchos pacientes, ya que los médicos  no llegaban a estos lugares. Es así como aprovecho y vio que la venta de medicamentos era una buena opción. Adicionalmente tiene además una  cartera de clientes, dandóle más ventaja en las ventas. Por lo general su esposo es quien la ayuda en el negocio, pero  ocasiones recibe la ayuda  de sus padres. Para el futuro, espera ampliar su botica  con la finalidad de seguir previniéndoles muchas enfermedades que afectan a sus clientes. Es por tal razón que Rocío visita a MPF, para solicitar su segundo  crédito por lo que ella se compromete en ser muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2000  soles que solicita, comprará más medicamentos para abastecer su botica.
texts.en:
Rocío is 35 years old and is married to Yuri, 30.  They have two children and live in their own home in the Pichari district.  

Rocío is a hard-working woman.  Before she had her pharmacy, she offered her medicines from door to door, traveling from one town to another.  She cared for many patients since doctors did not come to those areas.  That is how she saw that selling medicine was a good option.  She already had a client base, giving her an advantage in sales.  In general, her husband helps her with the business, but she also receives help from her parents.  

In the future, she hopes to expand to her pharmacy in order to prevent many of the diseases that affect her customers.  For this reason, Rocío visited MPF to ask for her second loan.  She promises to be very punctual with her payments.  With the 2000 soles she requested, she will purchase more medicines to stock her pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase more medicines to stock her pharmacy.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: Saturnina de 44 años de edad, convive con Roberto de 35 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicado en la comunidad de sector teresa del distrito de Pichari. Saturnina nunca olvidará aquellas tardes de su juventud en las que observaba a sus abuelos a remover la tierra y a la vez colocar semillas de cacao. Desde entonces apostó por la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de cacao, para así sacarle provecho todos los conocimientos que le dejaron sus abuelos, como el aplicar nuevas técnicas de siembra. Pero cuando es temporada de cosecha es cuando contrata peones. Actualmente el cacao, es un producto que tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello, que se siente satisfecha por las ganancias que recibe al vender su producto en Centros de Acopio de su localidad. En adelante ella piensa comprarse más terrenos, para así, competir de manera equitativa con sus vecinos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda concretar sus objetivos. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, comprará una moto pulverizadora
texts.en: Saturnina, 44, and her partner, Roberto, 35, have 3 chidren.  They live in a house that they own in Sector Teresa, a rural community in the Pichari district.  Saturnina has never forgotten the afternoons she spent as a teenager watching her grandparents prepare their fields for cacao.  She's a cacao farmer herself now, practicing everything that she learned from her grandparents then.  Using new technologies, for example, for sowing crops.  At harvest time, though, she hires farm laborers to help her.  There's a lot of demand for cacao now, both in Peru and abroad, and Saturnina is happy with the money her crops can make.  She sells what she harvests at the local Centros de Acopio [warehouse].  For the future, she wants to buy more land so that she can compete on an equal footing with neighboring farmers.  This is Saturnina's first MFP loan.  She is counting on your support to help her meet her goals.  She will use the 1500 soles loan to buy a motorized sprayer.

loans.use: to buy a motorized sprayer for her farming business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 60 años, convive con Macedonio D. 54 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Pichari. DesD. muy joven Teresa  se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo del cacao, pero cuando formalizó su familia, ella y su esposo adquirieron un pequeño terreno en donD. sembraron cacao y café, ambos frutos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado. Durante estos años han sido para Teresa  tiempos D. mucho sacrificio y privaciones, pero hoy nos comenta muy orgullosa que sino fuera por ello nunca hibiera logrado comprar su casa, ni tampoco hubieran ayudado a ssu hijos culminar la universidad. Solo espera en adelante tener una tienda para vender prendas D. vestir, pues el trabajo del campo para ella ya es muy agotador. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que ella nuevamente se compromete a ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 2,000  soles que solicita, comprará una moto sierra para que pueda podar sus plantas D. cacao.
texts.en:
Teresa is 60, and lives with Macedonio who is 54. They have 3 children, and live in their own house in the district of Pichari. Teresa has farmed since she was very young; specifically, growing cacao.  But when she started her family, she and her husband acquired a small plot of land where they grew cacao and coffee, two products for which there is a lot of market demand.  

For Teresa, these have been years of much sacrifice and hardship. But today, she says that she is very proud; that if it weren't for their crops, they would never have managed to buy their house, nor would they have been able to help their children finish university. In future, she just hopes to have a clothing store, since the work in the fields is now very tiring for her.

This is her second loan with MFP, so she is again committed to making her payments promptly. With the 2,000 soles she is applying for, she will buy a chain saw, so that she can prune her cacao plants.

loans.use: To buy a chain saw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture for her salon.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es: Franklin tiene 24 años,convive con kiara de 22 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. El trabajo al que se dedica es el cultivo de cacao, pues se considera como un negocio con mucho auge, pues éste fruto tiene mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional. Franklin siempre ha sido consecuente con sus objetivos trazados, desde luego que tuvo infinidades de barreras, pero no se amilanó frente a los problemas que existía en su camino, pero gracias a esa experiencia que tuvo, aprendió buenas lecciones en la vida. Ahora lo que más desea es poder intensificarse en la producción de este grano. Este es su primer crédito MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 soles que solicita, podrá contratar peones para que realicen la poda y extraer la maleza que crece entre las plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Franklin is 24 years old and married to Kiara, 22.  They have two children and live together in their own house in the Pichari district.  He works growing cacao, which he considers to be a business with a lot of growth, since there is a large demand for this product on a national and international level.  

Franklin has always been consistent with his objectives.  Of course, he had several barriers to overcome, but he was not daunted by the problems in his path.  Thanks to the experiences he had, he learned good lessons about life.  

Now he wants to increase his production of this crop.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he promises to make his payments punctually.  With the 1500 soles that he is requesting, he will be able to hire laborers to prune and weed his cacao plants.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina was born in 1966 in Achajur village, Tavush region. Then her family moved to Ijevan city, where Alina left secondary school.
 
Now Alina lives with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. Her son is serving in the Armenian army; her daughter is a student of Yerevan State University, Ijevan branch. Alina’s parents-in-law are retirees. 

Since 1994 Alina and her husband have been engaging in clothing sales. They rent a place at Ijevan market, where they sell men’s and women’s clothes, shoes and slippers as well. Alina says that women’s clothes are in bigger demand, so the major part of her merchandise is ladies' clothes and shoes. 


Alina says that her business allows her to keep her family, support her son in the army and also to pay for her daughter's education. This is Alina’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon and now she is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of men’s and women’s jeans to resell.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of men’s and women’s jeans to resell.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en: Gagik was born in 1957 in Lorut village, Lori region. He is married and has a daughter who works as a nurse at Vanadzor hospital. It is already a long time that Gagik and his family have been living in Vanadzor city. In Vanadzor, he has a small plot of land where he breeds pigs and sells pork to resellers. But the main body of Gagik’s business is selling dairy products. He buys cheese and butter from his native village, stores it and then resells it at Vanadzor market. Gagik’s wife helps him in his occupations and thus they support their family. Gagik received a loan from Nor Horizon 12 times and he has never delayed his repayments. Now he needs a 1,000,000 Armenian drams loan to buy a batch of dairy products from villagers and store it to sell later.

loans.use: To buy dairy products from villagers to sell

loans.name: Goharik

texts.ru:
Гоарик родилась в 1959 г. в селе Дастакерт, Сюникского регона, где она окончила среднюю школу, а затем и Араратский химико-технологический техникум, где получила специальность химико-технолога. 
В данной момент Гоарик проживает в селе Доврус и работает в сельской общине. Гоарик замужем, имеет сына и дочь, которая уже замужем и живет отдельно от родителей. Муж Гоарик работает в Зангезурском медно-молибденовом комбинате строителем. 
На протяжении долгих лет Гоарик разводит крупный рогатый скот, овец, а также выращивает овощи и фрукты. Ее сын помагает Гоарик на ферме. Также они арендуют небольшой участок земли, где они пасут своих коров и овец.
Выращенные овощи и фрукты Гоарик и ее семья продают на Капанском городском рынке, а говядину, баранину и молоко они продают прямо на своей ферме, а также отдают скупщикам с городского рынка. 
Благодаря сельскохозяйственной деятельности Гоарик и ее семья смогли приобрести грузовичок, при помощи которого они перевозят свою продукцию с фермы на городской рынок. 
Сумма кредита в 1.000.000 необходима Гоарик для покупки нескольких свиней, комбинированного корма для них, приобретения дизельного топлива, а также для покупки сельскохозяйственных средств для уборки сена.
texts.en:
Goharik was born in 1959 in the village Dastakert, in the Syunik region, where she graduated from high school and then from the Wine and Chemical Engineering College, where she received her degree in chemical engineering. 

Now, Goharik lives in Dovrus village and works in a rural community. Goharik is married and has a son and a daughter who are both married and live separately from their parents. Her husband works in the Zangezur Copper-Molybdenum Factory as a builder. 

For many years Goharik has bred cattle and sheep and grown vegetables and fruit. Her son helps Goharik on the farm. Also, they rent a small plot of land where they graze their cows and sheep. 

Goharik and her family sell the vegetables and fruit they produce in the Kapan city market, and their beef, mutton, and milk they sell from their farm, often to buyers who take the products to the big city markets. 

Due to the work on the farm, Goharik and her family were able to purchase a truck with which they transport their produce from the farm to the city market. 

Goharik needs a loan of 1,000,000 drams to buy a few pigs, fodder for them, diesel fuel, and everything necessary to harvest hay.

loans.use: to buy a few pigs, fodder for them, diesel fuel, and everything necessary to harvest hay.

loans.name: Armine

texts.ru:
Армине 27 лет, она родилась в городе Капан, где окончила среднюю школу, а затем  Ереванский Университет им. Ачаряна, по специальности прикладная математика и информатика. Армине замужем и имеет двух дочерей: старшей 7 лет, а младшей  3 года. Муж Армине работает на Капанской птицефабрике бухгалтером. Сама Армине занимается куплей-продажей  одежды начиная с 2006г. Она арендует помещение, где продает женскую, мужскую и детскую одежду, белье и обувь. Раз в месяц Армине приобретает товары из Еревана для своего бизнеса. Армине работает без выходных и помогает мужу содержать семью. 
Армине требуется кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для покупки сезонной одежды и обуви.
texts.en:
Armine is 27 years old. She was born in the town of Kapan where she graduated from high school, and then she graduated from Yerevan University of Acharyan where she majored in applied mathematics and computer science. Armine is married and has two daughters, a seven-year-old and a three-year-old. Armine's husband works at the Kapan poultry farm as an accountant. Armine has worked buying and selling clothes since 2006. She rents a shop in which she sells women's, men's and children's clothes, underwear and shoes. Once a month, Armine purchases goods from Yerevan for her business. Armine works seven days a week and helps her husband support the family.

Armine needs a loan of 500,000 drams to buy seasonal clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase high-grade manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase better hoes, pangas, manure, etc to use on his banana farm.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 36-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him, and his desire is to see his children graduate from college. He has a number of businesses such as rental houses, transport and farming. His major challenge is tenants who take a long time to pay their rent, and his dream is to build apartments in town.

Patrick intends to use the loan to renovate his commercial house. His dream is to own commercial houses for business purposes.

loans.use: to renovate his commercial house.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is a 35-year-old, married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal Uganda. His dream is to buy a plot of land in a trading center and also educate his children up to university.

Steven grows tomatoes on a large scale and has been doing so for 5 years amidst hardships of seasonal changes and product price fluctuations. None the less, he longs to clear more land and plant more tomatoes since the venture has proven to be worthwhile. Steven needs the loan to clear land for tomato growing.

loans.use: to clear land for tomato growing

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine is a 45-year-old, single mother of three children living in her own house in Kamwenge, Uganda. Ever since she separated from her husband, she has been looking after the family by herself. Her dream is to be able to provide her children with higher levels of education.

For 6 years Mourine has been selling food. Her desire is to own a food store in town despite challenges of unsettled debts by some customers. Mourine needs the loan to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 40-year-old, married man with two children living in his own house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He longs to educate his children up to university. For 6 years Peter has been selling spare (bicycle) parts and this has facilitated him in providing basics to his family. He has the challenge of bad debts. His dream is to set up a garage in town. Peter intends to use the loan to buy spare parts to sell.

The other person in the photo, wearing a white shirt, is a loan officer. This was done to gain the confidence of the client who was hesitant to be on the website.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
Lino 55 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Lino desde hace unos años se dedica a la comercialización de animales de corral (cerdos, ovejas y vacas), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de una vaca lechera y alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia. Lino con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo trata de salir adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia y brindarle a sus hijos otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
Lino, aged 55, lives with his wife and children in their own home which does not have running water or electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, which is part of Piura deparment.  This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For the last several years, Lino has worked in the business of farmyard animals (pigs, sheep and cows).  He raises them in his farmyard, which is the area outside of his home.  He feeds them on balanced animal feed and natural pastures.  Once they have achieved their ideal growth, he sells them to his customers or in the different area markets, and with the income he is able to cover his needs and his family's expenses.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a milk cow and balanced animal feed.  Once he has fattened his animals, he will sell them to his customers.  With the earnings, he will pay back the loan being offered, and improve his family's standard of living.

With much hard work and effort, Lino tries to move forward in life so as to be able to continue helping his family financially, and provide his children other opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Monica Pamela

texts.es:
Mónica de 23 años, es soltera, vive en casa de su madre, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.    Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Mónica se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares y de camisas para escolares, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace unos años, su mercadería lo ofrece a sus clientes que son en especialmente escolares y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades personales.

Al observar que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida  para seguir apoyando a su madre económicamente.
texts.en:
Mónica, 23, is single and lives in her mother’s house which has water and electricity and is located in La Matanza District that belongs to Piura Department, a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts making.

Mónica sells school supplies and shirts for school children, a business she set up at home several years ago.  She sells her merchandise to customers that are primarily students and uses the income obtained to cover her personal needs.

Seeing that her business is more profitable each day, she felt it necessary to request a 600 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy larger amounts of merchandise so that her clientele will continue to grow so that she can repay the loan and improve her quality of life to be able to continue helping her mother economically.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José 65 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en la zona urbana del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

José desde hace varios años se dedica a la comercialización de animales como (cerdos y vacas), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia. José con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo trata de salir adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia y brindarle a sus hijos mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
José, aged 65, lives with his wife and children in their own home, which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the urban area of Mórrope district, which is part of Lambayeque department.  This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

For the last several years, José has had an animal business (pigs and cows).  He raises them in his farmyard, which is right outside his home, and he feeds them on balanced animal feed and natural pastures.  Once they have achieved their ideal growth, he sells them to his customers or to the different markets in the area.  With the income he earns, he is able to cover his needs and family's costs.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternative to buy balanced animal feed.  Once he has fattened the animals up he will sell them to his customers, and with the earnings he will be able to pay back the loan being offered, and improve his family's standard of living.

With much hard work and effort, José tries to move forward in life, so as to be able to continue helping his family financially and provide his children with better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 39 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus abuelos, cuenta con sólo servicio de  luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Juan maneja su propia mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 2 año aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, apesar de la competencia, él trata en lo posible salir desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1200 nuevos soles y su destino será para la  compra de carpa y renovación de asientos para su mototaxi, con la finalidad de seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar su nivel de vida.  Juan es un hombre trabajador y con esfuerzo desea salir adelante  junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old, single and living in his grandparents’ house that only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Mórrope District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  Residents of this area are in farming, livestock raising and tourism.

Juan has driven his own mototaxi (means of transport for short distances with a maximum capacity of three passengers).  He carries out this activity in the same area where he lives.  Despite competition, he tries to get out as early as possible to move a good number of passengers to their various destinations and thus earn a larger amount of income to cover his expenses and personal needs.

The 1200 new sol loan he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for will be used to buy a tent and to renovate his mototaxi’s seats to continue providing good customer service and to improve his standard of living.  Juan is a hardworking man who wants to get ahead with his family through his own efforts.

loans.use: to buy a tent and to renovate his mototaxi's seats.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad,  vive con sus hijos menores de edad en casa de unos familiares, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracterizan por la actividad agrícola y ganadera de sus pobladores.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa para todas las edades, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace algunos años, pero también compra mercadería a pedido, también da a crédito o al contado a sus clientes, cobra cada fin de mes, tratando de brindarles facilidades a sus clientes, al contar con mayor demanda de clientes, sus ingresos aumentarán para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Al observar Rosa que su negocio cada día va creciendo a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para la época de invierno y abastecer su tienda con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela esté satisfecha para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a mother, and is 42 years old.  She lives with her children in the home of some relatives; they have running water and electricity.  The house is located in the district of Guadalupe, which is part of the department of La Libertad.  This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock and its people.

Rosa works selling clothes for all ages. She has run her business from her home for the last several years, but also buys merchandise on order.  She also offers credit or cash purchase to her clients and collects payment at the end of each month.  She is trying to provide facilities for her customers so as to have greater customer demand.  This will increase her income to cover her family's expenses.

On observing that her business was growing on a daily basis, Rosa felt it necessary to request a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  The loan will buy a greater quantity of merchandise for the winter season, and stock up her store with innovative products.  Her goal for this is that her customers are satisfied, and that she can pay back her loan and improve her children's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a greater quality of merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
La señora Maria Ines tine la edad de 53 años, solo estudio la primaria y es madre soltera, ella tuvo cuatro hijos los cuales ya estan casados y actualmente tiene a su cargo a dos de sus nietas con las que vive actualmente.

ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña tubo que trabajar y fue muy dificil ya que fue madre soltera y tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos, pero hace un poco mas de 16 años inicio a vender cosmeticos y perfumeria con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos dice que primero muestra sus catalagos a sus clientes levanta un pedido, lo encarga a sus proveedores y posteriormente cuando llegan los productos los entrega y recibe su pago, ella nos dice que ademas de vender cosmeticos tambien vende trastes casa por casapara ganar un poco de dinero extra ya que cada dia el diniero menos alcanza y tiene que ver por sus nietas. 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de perfumeria, cosmeticos y trastes para su posterior venta. 

doña ines se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por el apoyo que le han brindado por medio de estos creditos y espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea tener mas clientes ya que solo asi sus ganancias aumentaran y podra dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus nietas
texts.en:
Maria Ines is 53 years old, only studied through primary school, and is a single mother.  She has four children who are all married, and currently cares for two of her granddaughters who live with her.  

She tells us that since she was very young, she had to work and it was very difficult since she was a single mother and had to help her children get ahead.  More than 16 years ago, she started to sell cosmetics and perfumes to her friends and neighbors in her community.  First, she shows her catalogs to her customers and they place an order.  She places the order with her suppliers and later, when the products arrive, she delivers them and receives the payment.  In addition to selling cosmetics, she also sells dishes door to door in order to make a little extra money since every day her money covers fewer things, and she needs to care for her granddaughters.  

She needs this loan to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, and dishes to sell later.  

Maria Ines is very thankful to the foundation for the support they have given her through these loans, and hopes that with this investment, her business will prosper.  She hopes to have more customers so that her earnings will increase and she can give her granddaughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El señor Carmelo tiene la edad de 38 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, esta casado y tiene un hijo de un año de edad.

el nos platica que hace un poco mas de cinco años le ofrecio el director de la primaria de su comunidad el vender comida en la hora del recreo y acepto desde entonces vende antojitos mexicanos(empanadas, gorditas, tacos, tortas, tostadas, tacos dorados y enchiladas), refrescos y dulces en la primaria de lunes a viernes, tambien nos platica que los fines de semana vende carne de cerdo, el nos dice que un dia antes sale a levantar pedidos con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad y al otro dia despues de aliniar el cerdo entrega los pedidos y recebe el pago por su productos. El necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra chiles, tomates, cebolla,carne, tortillas, maiz, col, lechuga, sal , dulces, refrescos y cerdos para poder realizar sus ventas.

el espera que con este credio su negocio prospere ya que desea forgar un buen futuro para su familia y en un futuro poder pagar la universidad de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señor Carmelo is 38 years old.  He studied through high school, is married and has a one-year-old child.

He tells us that a little more than five years ago, the head of his community's elementary school offered him the opportunity to sell food at recess, and he accepted.  Since that time, he has been selling Mexican snacks (empanadas, gorditas, tacos, tortas, tostadas, tacos dorados and enchiladas), soft drinks and candy in the elementary school on Mondays through Fridays.  He also tell us that on weekends he sells pork.  He tells us that the first day, he goes out to take orders from his friends and neighbors in the community, and the following day he allocates the pork among the orders and receives payment for his products. 

He needs this loan to invest in buying chili peppers, tomatoes, onions, meat, tortillas, corn, cabbage, lettuce, salt, candy, soda and pork in order to make his sales.

He hopes that with this loan his business will succeed, as he wants to create a good future for his family and in the future to pay for college for his child.

loans.use: to sell Mexican snacks, and sell pork.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel tiene la edad de 50 años, estudio solo la primaria, es madre soltera de 2 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con dos de sus nietos uno de 16 años que asiste a la secuendaria y el otro nieto de 3 años que va al preescolar.

Ella nos platica que siempre le a gustado trabajar y que desde hace mas de 30 años tiene una pequeña refresqueria en su casa en la cual vende refresques, pulpa de tamarindo y cocadas, tambien nos dice que los fines de semana (sabado y domingo) vende casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad chiles rellenos, tamales y empanadas.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos, coco, azucar, tamarindo, leche, chile en polvo, maiz, carne, chiles, tomates, cebolla, huevos, arina y aceite para poder continuar con su negocio, ella nos dice que espera que con esta invercion ya que se gustaria invertir sus ganancias en la compra de plasticos (vasos, platos, cucharas, bandejas, tazas y toppers)para vender y asi hacer crecer su negocio.

Doña Isabel se encuentra muy feliz por el credito que ha recibido y agradece a la fundacion la confianza que le a dado al otorgarle este prestamo.
texts.en:
Isabel, 50, only completed elementary school.  She’s a single mother of two children but she currently lives only with two of her grandchildren, a 16-year-old who is in secondary school and a 3-year-old who is in preschool.

She relates that she’s always enjoyed working and that she’s had a small snack bar for over 30 years at home where she sells soft-drinks, tamarind pulp and macaroons.  She also tells us that on weekends (Saturday and Sunday) she sells chiles rellenos (stuffed peppers), tamales and turnovers door to door among her friends and neighbors in the community.

She needs this loan to buy soft-drinks, coconut, sugar, tamarind, milk, powdered chili, corn, meat, chilies, tomatoes, onions, eggs, flour and oil to continue with the business.  She tells us that she hopes that this investment will allow her to stay in business and that she’d like to use her profits to buy plastic ware (drinking glasses, plates, spoons, trays, cups and Tupperware) to sell and help her business to grow that way.  Isabel is very happy about the loan she’s gotten and thanks the foundation for the trust it’s placed in her by granting it.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her Mexican fast food items.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
La señora Domitila tiene la edad de 56 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria, es soltera y tiene un hijo de 19 años que estudia la preparatoria. 

ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 6 años inicio a vender refrescos en su hogar para ganar un poco dinero extra para sacar a delante a su familia y poco a poco con el paso del tiempo su negocio fue cresindo e inicio tambien a vender abarrotes, ella realiza sus ventas desde su casa ha puest algunas mesas y anaqueles en los cuales exibe sus productos, tambien nos dice que la C. de una tienda de abarrotes es tenerla muy bien surtida ya que asi sus clientes siempre encontraran lo que buscan y volveran a su tienda a hacerle el gasto.

Doña domitila nesecita este credito para invertirlo en la copra de arroz, frijol, aceite, refrescos, galletas, dulces, jabon, papel higienico, productos en la tados, huevos, pasta dental, sal y azucar para resurtir su tienda.

ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y obtenga mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten y asi poder construir un pequeño local y continuar la construccion de su casa.
texts.en:
Domitila is 56 years old, studied through high school, is single, and has a 19 year old son in high school.

She tells us that more than six years ago, she started to sell soft drinks in her home to earn a little extra money to get her family ahead.  Little by little with the passing of time, her business grew and she started to also sell groceries.  She sells from her home, where she has set up tables and shelves to display her products.  She says that the key to a grocery store is to have it very well stocked so that customers can find what they are looking for and will return to her store to make purchases.

Domitila needs this loan to purchase rice, beans, oil, soft drinks, cookies, sweets, ham, toilet paper, canned goods, eggs, toothpaste, salt, and sugar to restock her store.  

She hopes that this investment in her business will help it prosper and she will get more customers, which will increase her earnings.  She wants to build a small store and continue to do construction on her house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to restock her store.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Francisca tiene la edad de 70 años"pero un corazon de 18 años", solo estudio primaria ya que cuando ella era pequeña los padres preferian enseñar a sus hijas las labores del hogar y dar estudios a los varones,es soltera y tuvo dos hijos los cuales ya estan casados.

ella nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 8 meses abrio una pequeña tiendita de abarrotes en la parte de enfrente de su casa que da la caretera para poder ganar un poco de dinero extra para salir adelante, Doña franciasca es una señora muy alegre y entusiasta y nos dice que tiene muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, ella ademas de tener su tienda de abarrotes vende comida a los viajeros que se lo piden y asi puede tener mas entradas de dinero para seguir ayudandose.

 ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de galletas, dulces, refrescos, jugos, arroz, frijol, aceite, papel higienico, sal, arinas, cerillos y  jabon para resurtir su tienda ademas de un poco de insumos chiles, tomates, cebollas y  carne para la preparacion de su comida.

ella nos dice que espera que Dios le continue prestando vida para continuar trabajando y salir adelante, tambien envia un saludo a las personas que han hecho posible su cedito y que le dan la oportunidad de continuar trabajando para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 70 years old but has “the heart of an 18-year-old.” She only completed elementary school because when she was a little girl parents preferred to teach girls housework and send the boys to school.  She’s single and has two children who are married.

She tells us that a little over 8 months ago she opened a small grocery store in the front part of her house that faces the highway to earn a little extra money to continue moving forward.  Francisca is a very cheerful, enthusiastic person and she tells us that she very much wants to work and get ahead.  Besides her grocery store, she also sells food to travelers who request it and this is an extra source of income that helps her get by.

She needs this loan to buy cookies, candy, soft-drinks, juice, rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, salt, flour, matches and soap to restock the store and also a few ingredients like chilies, tomatoes, onions and meat for her meal preparations.

She tells us that she hopes God will continue to give her life to continue to work and get ahead.  She also sends greetings to people who have made her loan possible which gives her the opportunity to continue to work and to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora rafaela tiene la edad de 37 años, estudio hasta la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Gabino el cual trabaja como chofer, ellos tienen una hija que asiste a la escuela en su comunidad.

doña Rafaela nos platica que hace un poco mas de dos años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que cada dia la situacion economica esta peor.

Ella  nos platica que su negocio lo inicio ya que como su esposo es chofer le ponia lonche todos los dias y sus compañeros de trabaja le propusieron a su esposo pagarle a doña rafaela para que tambien les vendiera desayuno a ellos y ella acepto, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de comida corrida y antojitos mexicanos ya no solo con los choferes sino en toda su comunidad. ella necesita este prestamo para invertirlo en la compra insumos(chiles, tomates, cebolla, carne, frijol, arroz, azucsar, sal, gas, aceite, especies, repollo y refrescos)para la preparacion de sus alimentos y despues realizar sus ventas.

Doña Rafaela nos dice que lo que mas desea es que su hija pueda estudia una profesion y que su negocio cresca dia a dia un poco mas
texts.en:
Ms. Rafaela, 37, studied until high school and is married to Mr. Gabino, who works as a chauffeur. They have one daughter who goes to school in their neighborhood.

Rafaela tells us that a little over two years ago she decided to start working in her own business to be able to help her husband with the household expenses since with each day, the economy worsens.

She tells us that her business started as a result of making her husband lunch every day. His coworkers suggested to him that Rafaela sell breakfast to them each day, and she accepted the offer. Since then she has worked selling fast food and mexican snacks, not only to the group of chauffeurs, but also throughout the rest of the community. She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients (chiles, tomatoes, onion, meat, beans, rice, sugar, salt, gas, oil, spices, cabbage and soda) to prepare the food and then make her sales.

Ms. Rafaela tells us that her greatest desire is for her daughter to study a profession and for her business to grow a little bit, day by day.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as chiles, tomatoes, onion, meat, beans, rice, sugar, salt, gas, oil, spices, cabbage and soda.

loans.name: Laalegria-Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea tiene la edad de 41 años de edad, termino de estudiar la primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Adan que se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura. Ella nos platica que tiene una pequeña tiend de abarrotes  llamada "Abarrotes Garcia, Doña andrea nos dice que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo a mejorar  su hogar y ayudarlo con los gastos.

Ella inicio a trababjar en su negocio desde hace 3 años y nos platica que fue la segunda persona en abrir una tienda de abarrotes ella nos dijo "antas si habia tiendas pero solo vendian cerveza por eso iniciamos a vender los abarrotes", doña Andrea necesita este credito para la compra jabon, detergentes, productos enlatados, azucar, sal, frijol, arroz, arina, cafe, dulces, refrescos y jugos,

Doña Andrea espera con este credito resurtir de nuevos productos su tienda y que su negocio prospere y ser una de las mejores tiendas de su comunidad. 


Ella nos dice que se encuentra muy agradecida con la Fundacion por el prestamo que le dio.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea, 41, left school when she was very young.  She is married now to Sr. Adan, a farmer.  She tells us that she has a small grocery business called Garcia Grocery.  Dona Andrea started the business to help her husband with family expenses. 

She started it 3 years and tells us that she was the second person to open a grocery.  "There were stores before", she says, "but they only sold beer so we started selling groceries".  Dona Andrea needs this loan to buy soap, detergents, dairy products, sugar, salt, beans, rice, flour, coffee, snacks, sodas and juices.  

Dona Andrea hopes that restocking her store with new products will see her business prosper and be one of the best stores in the neighborhood.  

She says that she is very grateful to the Fundacion for this loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia tiene la edad de 52 años, estudio solo la secundaria y es madre soltera de 3 hijos de los cuales uno ya esta casado, otro trabaja y el mas pequeño asiste a la secundaria.

Ella nos platica que desde hace mas de 20 años vende antojitos mexicanos (empanadas, gorditas, papas, huevos, tostadas, chiles rellenos, garnachas y platanitos fritos) en el corredor de su casaque da a la carretera  los fines de semana (Viernes, sabado y domingo),  ella nos platica que sus clientes son sus vecinos y algunos viajeros que trancitan la carretera (Laguna chica/las josefinas). tambien nos dice que algunas veces realiza ventas entre semana de chiles reyenos o tamales los cuales primero ofrece con sus vecinos y posteriormente cuando ya estan listos sale a repartirlos. ella nos dice que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio ya que es madre soltera y tenia que sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles un poco de estudios.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de variedad de chiles, carne, huevos, aceite, arina, maiz, tortillas, mole, platanos, lechuga, tomate, cebolla, gas y refrescos para realizar sus ventas. Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospera ya que desea dar mas estudios y una mejor calidad de vida su hijo mas pequeño.
texts.en:
Silvia, 52, only completed secondary school.  She’s a single mother of three children.  One is married already, another is working and the youngest attends secondary school.

She tells us that for over 20 years she’s been selling Mexican fast food (turnovers, gorditas, potatoes, eggs, tostadas, chiles rellenos, garnachas and fried bananas) on weekends (Friday, Saturday and Sunday) in her house’s porch which faces the highway.  She tells us that her customers are her neighbors and some travelers that travel along the highway (Laguna Chica to Las Josefinas).  She also tells us that sometimes during the week she sells chiles rellenos or tamales which she offers to her neighbors and then, when they are ready, she goes out to sell them.  She tells us that she decided to start working in her own business because she’s a single mother and she had to raise her children and provide them with a bit of schooling.

She needs the loan to buy a variety of chilies, meat, eggs, oil, flour, corn, tortillas, mole, bananas, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, gas and soft-drinks to carry out her sales.  She hopes that this investment will lead to progress for her business because she wants to provide more schooling and a better quality of life for her youngest son.

loans.use: to make Mexican fast food items.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana tiene la edad de 60 años, estudio hasta el quinto grado de primaria y esta casada con el señor Jose que trabaja como albañil en su comunidad, ellos tuvieron un hijo el cual ya se encuentra casado.

Doña Juana nos platica que como cada dia la situacion economico esta peor, hace mas  de un año decidio iniciar a trabajar vendiendo gelatinas, chiles rellenos y tamales con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad para ganar un poco de dinero extra y asi ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella realiza sus ventas de gelatinas los dias miercoles, los chiles rellenos y tamales nos fines de semana (viernes, sabados y domingo), en el cual necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de leche, gelatina, azucar, vasos desechables, chiles, carne, tomates, cebolla, maiz, huevos, aceite y gas para la elaboracion de su comida y posteriormente salir a vender.

Ella nos dice que solo desea que Dios le diga dando fuerzas para seguir trabajando y asi poder continuar ayudando a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Juana is 60 years old, studied until the fifth grade of primary school, and is married to Jose, who works as a bricklayer in their community.  They have one son who is already married.

Juana says that since every day the economic situation is getting worse, more than a year ago, she decided to start selling gelatin, stuffed chiles, and tamales to her friends and neighbors in the community  to earn a little extra money and help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells gelatin on Wednesday and stuffed chiles and tamales on the weekends (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday).  

She is asking for this loan to purchase milk, gelatin, sugar, disposable cups, chiles, meat, tomatoes, onions, corn, eggs, oil, and gas to make her food and later go out to sell it.

She said that she only hopes that God gives her the strength to continue working so that she can continue to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make gelatin, stuffed chiles, and tamales.

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Ana Bertha tiene la edad de 20 años, solo estudio hasta el bachillerato y esta casada con el señor Carlos y trabaja como ayudante de Albañil, ellos aun no tiene hijos.
Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de 2 años inicio a trabajar en la venta de articulos para la cocina ya que deseaba ayudar a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y a formar un patrimonio para sus hijos que piensan tener en un futuro.
Ella realiza sus ventas casa por casa con sus amigos de la comunidad.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de ollas, bajillas, caserolas, sartenes, cucharas, vasos y platos para posteriormente venderlos en su comunidad.
Ella espera que con este credito su negocio pospere ya que desea en un futuro tener los recursos para darle a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y ofreceles estudios.
texts.en:
Ana Bertha is 20 years old and completed up to high school.  She is married to Carlos who works as a builder’s assistant.  They do not yet have children.

She tells us that she started to work selling kitchen items a little over two years ago, as she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses and build an inheritance for the children they plan to have in the future.

She makes her sales from house to house to her friends in the community.  She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of pots, dishes, casserole pots, frying pans, spoons, glasses and plates to later sell in her community.

She hopes that her business will prosper with this loan, as she wants to have the money to provide her future children with a good quality of life and schooling.

loans.use: to sell dishes.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria tiene la edad de 75 años solo estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria ya que en ese tiempo sus padres no tenian los recursos economicos para darle mas estudios, ella es viuda y solo tiene un hijo el cual ya esta casado.

Ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar y desde que falto su esposo a tenido que buscar la manera de salir adelante y a iniciado a vender tortillas, tacos y tortas, ella nos platica que cada tercer dia prepara una canasta llena de tortas y tacos y sale a ofrecerlos de casa en casa con sus amigos y conocidos de la comunidad y nos dice que gracias a Dios termina toda su venta, y sus ganancias las usa para comprar lo que ella necesita y reinvertir en la compra de insumos para la elabacion de su venta.

Tambien nos platica que algunos dias sus vecinos le hacen pedidos de tortillas a mano y se levanta desde muy temprano para ir al molino y despues para elaborar sus tortillas y poder entregar sus pedidos y de esta manera ganarse un poco de dinero extra, ella necesita este credito en la compra de maiz, pan, jamon, carne, mayoneza, lechuga, cebolla y leña para poder realizar sus actividades.

Ella nos dice que solo desea tener vida para seguir trabajando y salir adelante y envia un saludo a la fundacion un agradecimiento a la confianza que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 75 years old and only completed school up to third grade since her parents didn’t have the money at the time to pay for more schooling.  She is a widow and only has one son who is married.

She tells us that her parents taught her to work at a young age and since her husband passed away, she has had to find a way to get ahead.  As a result, she has started to sell tortillas, tacos and sandwiches.  Every three days she prepares a basket of sandwiches and tacos and sells them house to house to her friends and acquaintances in the community.  She tells us that thanks to God, she sells all of them and uses her earnings to buy what she needs and to reinvest in the purchase of supplies to make her sales.

She also tells us that her neighbors sometimes put in orders for handmade tortillas, so she gets up very early to go to the mill and later make the tortillas and deliver the orders so that she can earn a bit of extra money.  She needs this loan for the purchase of corn, bread, ham, meat, mayonnaise, lettuce, onion and firewood in order to run her business.

She tells us that she wants to live to continue working and getting ahead.  She thanks Fundación Realidad A.C. for the trust they have given her.

loans.use: to sell food.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Eliana tiene 33 años, solo estudio la preparatoria y es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años de edad que asiste al preescolar y una niña de 9 años que asiste a la primaria de su comunidad.
Ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña su madre le enseño a trabajar pero ahora que es madre soltera tiene que trabajar mas duro para poder sacar a sus hijos adelante, ella nos platica que todos los dias realiza ventas de fruta de temporada, frituras, semillas, cacahuates, en una pequeña mesa que saca todos los dias al frente de su casa que da la calle, ella nos dice que se vende muy bien pero cuando baja la venta hecha en una bolsa lo que vende y sale a venderlo casa por casa tambien nos platica que todas las tarde sale a vender a otra comunidad la fruta que este de temporada, ahorita hace bolsas de nanches las cuales vende a 10 pesos y nos dice que se vende muy bien.
Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de bolsas desechables, semillas, frituras, fruta, cacahuates, chile en polvo, chamoy y limones, para poder realizar su venta y asi vender sus productos.
Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y poder pagar los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eliana is 33 years old and only completed high school.  She is a single mother of a 3-year-old son who is in preschool and a 9-year-old daughter who goes to elementary school in their community.

She tells us that her mother taught her to work at a young age but now that she is a single mother, she has to work harder in order to get her children ahead.  She also tells us that she sells seasonal fruit, fried foods, seeds and peanuts at a small table she puts in front of her house facing the street every day.  Her sales are good but when they drop, she puts what she sells into a bag and goes door to door.  She also goes every afternoon to another community to sell fruit in season.  She now prepares bags of nance which she sells at 10 Mexican Pesos (MXN) and she says that they sell well.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of disposable bags, seeds, fried foods, fruit, peanuts, chili powder, chamoy and lemons in order to make sales and sell her products.  She hopes that her business will prosper with this loan, as she wants to provide her family with a better quality of life and be able to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to sell fruits and fried food.

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es:
Andrés, de 57 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de lubricantes, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Cuando el empezó en esta actividad lo hizo atravez de un crédito pues no contaba con capital propio, antes de vender lubricante el trabajaba como transportista y era comerciante al mismo tiempo, vendía granos básicos, pero decidió retirarse pues no le producía mucha rentabilidad y sus ganancia eran muy pocas, fue entonces que decidió vender lubricantes, atravez del cual ah tenido mejores ganancias que en sus negocios anteriores.      
Requiere el préstamo para comprar lubricantes. Con esta inversión piensa mantener su inventario surtido y variado de todo tipo de lubricantes que demanden sus clientes, el considera que el lugar de venta donde esta ubicado su negocio es un buen punto de venta, pero lo que necesita es mas producto que ofrecer para no perder clientes, desea mejorar su local ampliarlo mas, mejorar el nivel de sus ventas. Su meta próxima es preparar a sus hijos con una carrera profesional para que ellos sean  alguien en la vida y sean independientes.
texts.en:
Andrés is 57 years old and resides in the city of Estelí. He is married with five children and he is a merchant who sells lubricants. He has been in this business for seven years and started it through a loan, as he did not have his own capital. Prior to selling lubricant, he worked simultaneously in transportation and as a merchant selling basic grains. However, he decided to leave that business since it wasn’t very profitable and his earnings were very low. As a result, he decided to sell lubricants and has had better earnings than with his previous businesses.

He is requesting the loan to purchase lubricants. With this investment, he plans to keep his inventory stocked with all types of lubricants his customers demand. He considers the location of his place of business to be good for sales. However, he needs more products to sell so that he does not lose customers. He wants to improve his place of business, expand it, and improve his sales. His next goal is to provide his children with a professional education so that they will be someone in life and will be independent.

loans.use: to buy lubricants.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth de 52 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Chocope que pertenece a la provincia de La Libertad.  Zona de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Elizabeth cuenta con su negocio de comida en un puesto que a colocado en lugar concurridopor las personas de la zona donde vive, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocida por la limpieza y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar insumos y utensilios, para  seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con sus ganancias cubrir sus gastos de su hogar.  Elizabeth con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que en un futuro tenga un restaurante donde ofresca todo tipo de comida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 52, lives in her own house which only has electricity with her husband and children.  It’s located in Chocope District that belongs to La Libertad Province.  It’s a primarily farming and livestock raising area.

Elizabeth has a business of her own consisting of a food stand located in her neighborhood in an area that has lots of passersby.  She’s been in this activity for several years and she has an established clientele of her own.  She’s known for her cleanliness and tasty dishes.  Income she earns will allow her to have better quality of life for her family.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy ingredients and utensils to continue providing good customer service and use profits to cover household expenses.  Elizabeth has won over the trust of her customers with her work and desire to get ahead.  In the future, she’d like to have a restaurant where she can offer all types of food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils to continue preparing her food.

loans.name: Cesar Enrique

texts.es:
César es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

César se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  César es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere.
texts.en:
César is a 30-year-old father living with his wife and children in his own house which only has electricity and is located in Tambogrande District belonging to Piura Department, an area known for farming, cattle raising and crafts making.

For several years now César has been raising and selling pigs.  His corral is in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and once they reach optimum growth he can sell them to his customers and use income obtained to cover household expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy more animals and their respective feed.  Once they are fattened up he sells them to various local markets with the goal in mind of obtaining a better price for them in order to have increased income and a better quality of life.  César is a hardworking, dedicated person.  The only thing he wants is that his family gets ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their respective feed.

loans.name: Santos Bernabe

texts.es:
Santos de 40 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura,  ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino y caprino (tiene 20 ovejas y 30 cabras) desde hace 5 años, el lugar donde cría  a sus animales es en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar de alimento balanceado y para mejorar sus corrales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados y cuidados para ofertarlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes.  Santos es una mujer dedicada y trabajadora porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con el anhelo de que en un futuro su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Santos, 40, lives with her family in her own house which only has electricity and is located in Tambogrande District belonging to Piura Department.  These areas are noted for farming, cattle raising and crafts making.

The activity Santos carries out is raising sheep and goats to sell (she has 20 sheep and 30 goats); she’s been in business five years.  The area where she raises the animals is in her back yard.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses.  Once they reach ideal size and weight she sells them in the various markets because she has her own clientele.  Income obtained is used to meet family needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to do some improvements in her corrals which will make it possible for her to have them well fed and cared for so that she can sell them to her customers at a better price.  Santos is a dedicated, hardworking woman who is always concerned for her loved ones’ well-being hoping that her business will grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to make improvements to her corrals.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana de 59 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio de luz solamente, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Santa Cruz que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Desde hace algunos años Juana se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, fideos, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio ha solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías y de aves de corral, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Juana es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que se preocupa por brindarles más comodidades a sus hijos y esposo.
texts.en:
Juana, 59, lives with her husband and children in her own house which only has electricity and is located in a rural part of Santa Cruz District that belongs to Cajamarca Department.  This zone is noted for farming, cattle raising and tourism.

Juana has been selling basic need items (milk, rice, oil, sugar, noodles, etc.) and beverages for several years.  Her business is located in her house for her comfort and safety.  Profits obtained from the sale of her products she tries to use to cover her expenses and improve her family’s standard of living.

To expand the business she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy more merchandise and barnyard fowl.  Her only ideal is that the business grows and that she has a wider selection of stock merchandise to offer her customers.  Juana is a hardworking, dedicated person who strives to provide more comforts for her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Silvia Jannet

texts.es:
Silvia de 35 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Guadalupe que pertenece al departamento de La libertad.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Silvia desde hace algunos años se ha dedicado a vender videos musicales y películas de forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Guadalupe, tiene su propia clientela porque siempre cuneta con las últimas películas que salen y con los ingresos que logre obtener puede solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.

Ha solicitado a un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más videos musicales y de películas que le piden sus clientes, al contar con mercadería actualizada aumentar sus clientes al igual que sus ganancias, lo que le permitirá cubrir su préstamo otorgado y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  Silvia es una mujer alegre, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de poderle brindar a sus hijos otras oportunidades académicas y más comodidades en su hogar.
texts.en:
Silvia, 35, lives with her family in her own house that has water and electricity and is located in an urban part of Guadalupe District belonging to La Libertad Department, a zone noted for farming, cattle raising and tourism.

Silvia has been selling music and film CDs in an ambulatory way in the market in Guadalupe for several years.  She has her own clientele because she always stocks the latest released films.  She can use income she manages to obtain to cover her family’s daily needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more music and film CDs that her customers request.  Having up to date merchandise available will increase her customers as well as her profits which will make it possible for her to repay the loan as well as provide her family with improved quality of life.  Silvia is a cheerful, hardworking woman who very much wants to provide her children with other academic opportunities and more comfort at home.

loans.use: to buy more music and movie CDs to stock her store.

loans.name: Paul Michael

texts.es:
Paul es un hombre soltero de 27 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual  es propia y cuenta con los servicio agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Pacanga que pertenece  al departamento de la Libertad.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Paul labora desde hace unos 3 años realizando servicio de transporte público en su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) la cual trabaja diariamente mañana y tarde, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus gastos y necesidades personales.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindarle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que estaba presentando algunas fallas, al encontrarse en buen estado podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y con las ganancias que adquiera mejora  su calidad de vida para seguir ayudando a sus pares con los que vive.  Paul es un hombre conocido  por ser trabajador, responsable que a punta de esfuerzo y empeño ha sabido salir adelante, con el objetivo que de que más adelante pueda comprarse otra mototaxi para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Paul, 27, is single living with his parents in their own house which has electricity and water and is located in the urban part of Pacanga District belonging to La Libertad Department.  Residents of this district are farmers and raise livestock.

Paul has been working for the last three years providing public transportation services in his mototaxi (mode of transportation used to go short distances with a maximum of three passengers).  He works every day, morning and afternoon.  Income obtained makes it possible for him to cover his costs and personal needs.

The loan he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa is in the amount of 1000 new soles and it is earmarked to provide service for the mototaxi because it’s starting to have some mechanical difficulties.  Being in good condition he will be able to offer better customer service and profits he obtains will improve his quality of life to continue helping his parents that he lives with.

Paul is a man known for being hardworking and responsible who through effort and dedication has gotten ahead.  His future goal is to buy another mototaxi to continue working.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: Catherine de 32 años es una mujer alegre y con ganas de salir adelante en la vida. Es madre soltera de dos hijos, quienes son su mayor motivo para superarse. Vive en la casa de su madre y espera pronto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus hijos.
