Estelita, 60 years old, is married. Her family’s main income comes from agriculture. Estelita has her own land for planting rice. She has a livestock business where she raises pigs to sell in the future.

Estelita would like to increase the number of livestock and to develop her business further. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase more pigs and feed. Increasing the number of livestock will help Estelita to get more income and to improve her family’s living conditions. Estelita lives together with her husband and three children.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma keeps livestock and cultivates land. She is 37 years old and married. Emma would like to increase the number of livestock she owns and to develop her agriculture business. Developing her agricultural business will help Emma to increase her income and to ensure better living conditions for her family, who help her with her business. 

Emma is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and piglets to raise. She has been in this business for two years. Additional income will also enable Emma to provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed.

loans.name: Virgielyn

texts.en:
Virgielyn, 23 years old, is married and has one infant daughter. At her young age, she is  working hard for the future of her family. Her husband is the one who manages their farm. While Virgielyn is busy for her business making charcoal to sell in the community.

Virgielyn is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy wood and fuel for doing her charcoal. She has been in this business for two years.

Virgielyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood and fuel for her charcoal business.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia, 47, is a poor woman who has worked hard and operated her farming business for over four years. On average, Emilia is able to earn around PHP 150 each day for her daily expenses. As a part-time job, she often goes to buy some firewood to burn in order to produce charcoal. Her husband normally takes the charcoal from her, as well as buying some from other charcoal producers, to sell in their community in Isabela Province. 

This couple tries to help each other to support their four children, all of whom are still living under their roof and depend on their daily income. Emilia will be using her loan for purchasing additional firewood to burn into charcoal that she can sell. She will get more profit from her charcoal-selling business. For the remainder of the funds, she intends to plant corn and purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and wood for her charcoal business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her three children. She is dedicated to raising pigs. Her husband is unemployed and pig breeding is the only one source of income for her family. 

Gloria has two years of experience in the pig breeding business. She usually purchases piglets, then fattens them and resells them in the local market. Her monthly income is about PHP 1,500. Gloria's hope is to purchase more animals, to expand her business. To reach this goal, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.

loans.use: to feed and provide vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 42 years old, married, and lives in the province of Isabela with her children. She always perseveres and has a fighting spirit.

Rose Marie is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and piglets and to raise. 

Rose Marie has always worked hard by caring for animals and does very well from it. This loan will improve her family's living conditions and help her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy feed and pigs to raise.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita lives in the province of Isabela. She is 36 years old, married, and has three grown-up children.  Benita sells different products, such as bread, soap, shampoo, and spices that she can offer to the people of the community. 

Benita started her business when she was 20 years old and had the help of her mother, who was in the same line of work and managed a store. As time passed, Benita became independent from her mother and opened her own store. Today she sells a variety of products throughout the entire village. Her husband helps to support her with whatever he earns from his job. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy drinks, soap, candies and vinegar.  With this investment, she hopes to increase her sales and offer a wider variety of products. Her future plans include opening a general store at the market.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, drinks, bread and spices for her store

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita, 40 years old and married, lives in a rural area of Isabela, an agricultural area. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.

Lucita is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy drinks, bread, rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a "sari-sari store", where you can find all the daily needs.

She will use the profits to invest in her business. Some of the profit will also be saved. Her most important and difficult challenge is to pay for her children's fees. That is difficult because the cost is very high, but she thanks God she has her business and generates extra income. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, spices and bread

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Erlinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Lydia has a furniture shop that sells wooden furniture like dining tables & chairs. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw materials for making furniture.

Lydia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lydia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Eva has a retail shop that sells fruits, vegetables & spices. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional fruits to sell.

Eva is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animals and the respective feed.

loans.name: Ma. Daisy

texts.en:
Ma. Daisy is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Ma. Daisy has a retail shop that sells fruits & vegetables like bananas & watermelons. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy bananas & vegetables to sell.

Ma. Daisy is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ma. Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bonebe Ann

texts.en:
Bonebe Ann is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Bonebe Ann has a retail shop that sells fruits like watermelons. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy watermelons to sell.

Bonebe Ann is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Bonebe Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy watermelons to sell

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 29 years old and married with three school-aged children. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Five years ago, Elvie started to engage in a motor transport activity, "habal-habal" (two-wheeled vehicle capable of carrying 2-6 passengers), which is commonly seen in rural mountainous areas. The work gives her a total of PHP 1,500 income a month.

Last year in 2010, she joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from the cooperative. This is Elvie's third loan application with GDMPC. The money is specifically intended to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts to improve service quality. She hopes to spare a portion of her earnings for maintenance costs and expand the current service offerings.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with nine children.
 
Nilda has a retail shop that sells fruits & vegetables like melons & squash. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy squash & melons to sell.

Nilda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy squash & melons to sell

loans.name: Vencent

texts.en:
Vencent is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with one child. 

Vencent is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for his motorela services.

Vencent is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Vencent hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Rodulfo is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline used for his motorela services.

Rodulfo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rodulfo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nenita has a retail shop that sells vegetables like tomatoes. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tomatoes & other vegetables to sell.

Nenita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Nenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes & other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is from the village of San Antonio in the province of Isabela. She is 30 years old and lives in the village with her husband Dante and children. Diana works as a housewife. The total average monthly income of the family is PHP 3,000. 

Diana requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to expand the family business. In particular, she will buy four piglets and food for them. After the piglets are grown, in four or five months, they will be sold at a higher price. The additional profits earned by the family will help them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Fe has a food shop that sells viands like afritada, pancit bihon & caldereta. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to cook viands to sell.

Fe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed to cook viands to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 54 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Olga se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de repuestos de moto y otros productos similares, su negocio lo tiene en un local cerca de su casa, cuenta con regular clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos diarios de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de repuestos para seguir comercializándolo y con lo que adquiera de dinero pagará su crédito y mejorara el nivel de vida de su familia. Olga es una mujer de alegre y con mucho trabajo a logrado sacar a su familia adelante y le está permitiendo tener un poco más de comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Olga is 54 years old and lives in a house with her family. They do not receive basic services. Olga resides in the rural section of the District of Las Lomas, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture and livestock breeding.

Olga has been selling motorcycle parts and other similar products for several years. Her business is located in a shop near her home. She has a regular customer base and the income she generates is used to cover her needs and the daily household expenses.

Olga is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN in order to buy a large quantity of spare parts so that she can continue selling them. The money she earns will be used to repay the loan and improve her family’s standard of living. Olga is a cheerful woman who works hard so that she can move her family forward and provide them a few more household comforts.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of parts to sell in her business.

loans.name: Guirmen Augusto

texts.es: Guirmen, de 40 años es padre de dos hijos, vive en casa propia junto a sus menores hijos y su esposa con quien comparte la educación de sus hijos.El señor Guirmen empieza su jornada laboral muy temprano. Sale a las 4:30 de la madrugada a las calles de la ciudad en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros quienes tienen necesidad de transportarse de un lugar a otro. Lleva 20 años en esta actividad, tiempo en el cual aprendió mucho del negocio.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene disposición de su tiempo ya que sabe en que momentos hay mas afluencia de pasajeros y en que momento puede ir a su casa a hacer algunos quehaceres. Lo que no le gusta es que el sol es muy fuerte y el estado de las pistas maltrata su vehículo y le dañan sus riñones. Espera poder más adelante comprar una unidad mas para así poder empezar a alquilar y tener un ingreso extra.Lleva 6 años con la institución, dice que le agrada trabajar con MFP ya que los intereses son bajos y sobre todo puedes acceder a un seguro no solo para ti, si no también para tu familia.Con el préstamo solicitado 1000 soles, el espera poder comprar algunos repuestos para su mototaxi y así mejorar la imagen de su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Guirmen, 40, is the father of two children.  He lives in his own house with his minor children and his wife with whom he shares the children’s education.

Guirmen starts his work day very early.  He sets off at 4:30am to seek out customers along the city streets that need to be transported from place to place.  He’s been in this line of work for 20 years, time in which he’s learned quite a bit about the business.

What he likes about his work is that he can manage his own time since he knows at what times passengers are plentiful and when he can go home to do chores there.  What he dislikes is that the sun is very strong and the state of the roads is such that his vehicle becomes damaged as do his kidneys.  He hopes later on to be able to buy another vehicle to lease it out and earn extra income.

He has been with the institution six years.  He says he likes to work with MFP because interest rates are low but, above all, because you can access a secure loan not just for yourself but for your family as well.  He will use the requested 1000 soles to buy some replacement parts for his mototaxi to improve the appearance of his work tool.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es:
María de 45 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.
	
La actividad que desarrolla María es la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras) desde hace unos años, el lugar donde cría  sus animales es en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y pastos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la zona donde vive y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento para los mismos, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un buen precio a sus clientes.  María es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos, con la finalidad que en un futuro pueda brindarles mejores estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. They do not receive basic services. María resides in the rural section of the District of Mórrope, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area is known for having businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and tourism.

María has been raising and selling goats for a few years. The animals are kept in an area behind her house and are fed a diet of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the ideal size and weight, they are offered for sale at the different markets. María has her own customer base in the area where she lives. With the income she earns, María is able to cover her daily household needs.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN in order to buy more animals and the appropriate feed. This will allow her to provide the animals an adequate diet so that she can offer them to her customers at a good price. María is well-known in the place where she lives because she is concerned about her family’s well-being. Her goal for the future is to provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 66 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pítipo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Alejandro desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y aves de corral), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y su respectiva comida, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Alejandro es un hombre que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño ha sabido sacar adelante a su familia, lo que le da mucho orgullo.
texts.en:
Alejandro, age 66, lives with his wife and children in his own house.  The house does not have the basic services.  It is located in the rural zone of the Pítipo district in the Lambayeque department.  The zone is known for farming, livestock, and handicrafts.

Alejandro has been selling animals like pigs and poultry for several years.  He raises them in corrals, which are appropriate and ample, that he has behind his house.  He feeds them balanced feed, grains, and natural fodder so that they reach their ideal growth.  That way he will be able to sell them at different markets in the area and get good income to pay for the family expenses.

He has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more animals and their feed.   With the income he gets from selling his animals he will be able to pay for the loan, and he will be able to have a better quality of life.

Alejandro is a man who with effort and great determination has known how to get his family ahead, and this makes him very proud.

loans.use: to buy more animals and their feed.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Juliet has a beauty shop that provides haircuts & pedicures. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy materials & beauty products needed for the salon.

Juliet is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials & beauty products

loans.name: Ann Marie

texts.en:
Ann Marie is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Ann Marie has a food shop that sells snacks like rice cakes & halo-halo or flavored ice salad. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients to make snacks & flavored ice salad.

Ann Marie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ann Marie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks & flavored ice salad

loans.name: Ariole

texts.en:
Ariole is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single & he belongs to the third sex gender. 

Ariole is providing services like hair cutting, pedicure & manicure. He has had this business for 13 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy beauty products & pay for the utilities for the services.

Ariole is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ariole hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products & pay for utilities

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 44 years old, male and married with two children attending school. They live in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. The primary source of income for the village comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for future merchandise. Elsie and his wife have been engaged in rice production for almost 12 years now, which provides them an income every harvest season twice a year. Elsie usually earns about PHP 15,000 each harvest season.

Due to the expensive cost of farm inputs, he is asking for a loan to have additional capital to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. With the help of this loan, he can improve his crop production.
 
In the future, he would like to continuously educate his children and earn a degree for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Elsie has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell.

Elsie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Rita has a retail shop where she sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy fish to sell.

Rita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
As heads of the family, Mrs. Pech and her husband always worry about how to create more benefits for their family. She has five children. Two of her children are married and live separately. Three of her children are single. One of them is working in a hotel in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

 Presently, Mrs. Pech opens a retail store where she sells in front of her house. She's owned her business for many years. With the proceeds from the product sales she tries to cover all her expenses and improve her family's quality of life. With the aim of attaining a more comfortable standard of living, Pech wishes to borrow some funds through Kiva in order to purchase a motorbike for transporting her items.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for transporting her items.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is a loving husband to his wife and a responsible father of his three children. He is 51 years of age, married and hopes to uplift his family's living conditions.

Danilo wants to borrow additional capital, amounting to PHP30,000, to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. Because of his dedication to his work, Danilo is proud to share that, through the business, he can successfully send his children to school and finish their studies. 

Danilo always plans for the development of his business. He will give his best efforts in managing the business to achieve his goal in reality.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Ramonita has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy beverages, canned goods & snacks.

Ramonita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ramonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods & snacks.

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the treasurer of this group. She is 44 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised six children: three daughters and three sons. The older daughter and the older son are working in Bishkek, and the other children study at school. The sons help Gulmira cultivate agricultural products; they grow 0.5 hectares of potatoes and 1.5 hectares of wheat. Selling some part of the harvest, Gulmira earns about 3000 soms per month. She has applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase clothes for her children. In the future Gulmira wants to improve the family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for herchildren.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Perlita has a retail shop where she sells snacks, breads, beverages & noodles. She has had this business for 5 years. She hasrequested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Perlita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Perlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene (37 años) convive con el padre de sus 2 hijos y un nieto, vive en casa propia que pudo comprar con la ayuda de su esposo ya que ambos se dedican a trabajar arduo para darles buena educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida.Marlene se dedica a una actividad muy rentable en la ciudad. Ella sale por las noches a la vereda a vender comida, este trabajo ya lo viene realizando por 10 años. Su trabajo lo hace sola ya que sus hijos trabajan y su esposo es chofer de una mototaxi.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre hay movimiento y todos los días hay buenos ingresos, además ella sabe que en el negocio de la comida nunca nada se pierde. Ella tiene muchos planes a futuro,  entre ellos esta arreglar su local y emprender en una nueva actividad para la cual está comprando ropa de la ciudad de Lima para venderla en su localidad.Este es el cuarto préstamo entre Marlene y la institución MFP, le esta yendo bien y su grupo le parece bueno ya que todos son responsables hasta ahora.Con el préstamo solicitado 1800 soles ella comprará ingredientes e insumos para su venta de comida, además de invertir en el mejoramiento de su local.
texts.en:
Marlene, 37, lives with the father of her two children and a grandson in their own house, which they were able to buy because they worked hard to give their children a good education and a higher quality of life.  Marlene works in a field that is very lucrative in her city.  She goes out on the sidewalk at night to sell food, which she has been doing for the last ten years.  She does this work on her own, since her children work, and her husband drives a motorcycle taxi.

She likes the fact that her business gets a lot of traffic, and she makes a good income every day.  She also knows that nothing is ever lost in the food business.  She has many plans for the future, among them to improve her location and to start a new business buying clothes in Lima to sell locally.  

This is her fourth loan with microfinance partner MFP.  She will use this loan of 1800 soles ($675) to buy ingredients and materials for her food business, as well as to invest in improving her location.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her food business and to invest in improving the ambiance of her location.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Bernadette has a retail shop where she sells ready to wear clothing, like blouses & t-shirts. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional clothing to sell.

Bernadette is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Bernadette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng, 32, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. His children are school-aged.  Heng grows short-cycle crops, such as corn and rice and sells his products in the wholesale market. With the loan he plans to buy corn and rice seeds and fertilizer. 

The loan helps him economically to meet his needs. He is up against challenges such as crop plagues and lack of money to hire more workers. So Heng would like to borrow some funds through Kiva for the purpose of purchasing seeds and fertilizer. His dream is to send all his children to study at a high level.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa's Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the treasurer of this group. She is 60 and ,unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised a son, 27 years old, who earns his livelihood by cultivating and selling agricultural products. In this way the family earns 5000 soms per month. With the profits gained from the trade, Rosa purchased household appliances and improved the family’s living conditions. With money received from the loan, Rosa wants to purchase livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future she wants to repair the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married and has one son. Her husband is a farmer. Jenny wants to start a grocery store to help her husband cover the family's expenses, since the income of the family isn't enough. Therefore, she needs to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to support the family.

Jenny will use the loan to buy some necessary goods such as boxes of milk, candies, snack foods and spices. This will enable Jenny to have her own project, which will add value to the family income and enhance their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy candies, milk, coffee, drinks, bread and canned goods.

loans.name: Sarah Mae

texts.en:
Sarah Mae  is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is single and has 2 children. 

Sarah Mae  has a retail shop that sells beauty products and clothing.  She has had this business for 3 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy beauty products and clothing from NATASHA and AVON to sell.

Sarah Mae  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sarah Mae  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and clothing from NATASHA and AVON to sell

loans.name: Zulfiya's Group

texts.en:
Zulfiya is the treasurer of this group.  She is 24 and married to a taxi driver.  Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and a son, both of whom are preschool age (under seven).  

Zulfiya’s husband earns money by transporting passengers.  He earns 8,000 soms per month; this profit makes them able to meet the family’s daily needs.  Zulfiya applied for the loan because she needs financial funds for purchasing auto parts to repair her husband’s vehicle.  Half of the loan Zulfiya plans to spend on purchasing livestock for breeding, fattening and reselling.  In the future the family dreams to open their own auto repair center. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts to repair the taxi

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 59-year-old fisherman who is a widow with seven children. He lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Three of his children are married and live separately, another two are single and live with him, and the youngest two attend school. One of Ly’s sons helps generate income by running a motor taxi and one of his daughters sells vegetables and earns about 3 USD daily selling her produce in the local market. 

Ly is always considering how to create more income to support his family. He is requesting a loan to invest in his daughter’s business. The increased income will help improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in his daughter's business

loans.name: Koeprieng

texts.en:
Koeprieng (pictured above) is 28 years old and her husband, Sung is 30 years old.  They live across the Mekong River, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married since 2003 and have two young children, one son and one daughter.

Koeprieng sells fish that her husband catches.  She also buys additional fish from other fisherman and sells them in the local market.  Her husband is a fisherman and farmer.  Koeprieng is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle to carry fish to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to carry fish to the market.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny (in the photo), 64, is a widow.  She lives along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She has two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons are married and live outside the family home and the daughter is a garment worker.

Ny sells cakes in her village.  She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help her son’s business by purchasing additional raw seafood (squid scallop and shrimp) for sale.

loans.use: To help her son’s business by purchasing additional raw seafood (squid scallop and shrimp) for sale.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, age 60, sells bags and clothing.  Her husband is a retired school principal.  They live along national road number two about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They have been married for almost thirty years and have three married children, two sons and one daughter.

Sophy is requesting a loan of $500 to expand her business by buying additional bags and clothing for sale.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying additional bags and clothing for sale.

loans.name: Sonun

texts.en:
Sonun lives in Balykchi, a small town in Isykul region. She is 53 and, unfortunately, a widow. She has raised a son who is 23 and works as a policeman. Sonun went into business 10 years ago selling fish in a local market, but now runs a business selling hosiery and women's underwear. She earns about 8,000 soms a month, a good salary, and is applying for this loan to buy school uniforms to sell this fall. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to improve her life by repairing her house and buying new furniture. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and see a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Floripes

texts.es: Rosa, de 36 años es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales solo uno es mayor de edad y no depende de ella, pero sus otros dos hijos son menores y viven junto a ella en una casa propia en donde con su esposo son responsables de la educación de los menores.Rosa es una mujer que le gusta estar activa, aunque no tiene un trabajo estable siempre esta buscando algo que hacer ya que la actividad le permite tener tiempo disponible, su actividad consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, pues posee tres unidades gracias a su trabajo que empezó hace aproximadamente unos cinco años. Ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga de una mototaxi mientras que las otras dos la pone en alquiler.Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que siempre tiene un ingreso extra ya que ella tiene disponibilidad de tiempo además siente que gana mucho en este negocio ya que sus unidades son manejadas por personas responsables que no maltratan las mismas. Rosa tiene en mente poder comprar algunas unidades más ya que le gustaría agrandar su flota de vehículos.Este es el tercer préstamo entre Rosa y MFP, le gusta mucho pertenecer al grupo en el que esta ya que siente que todos son responsables.Espera poder comprar con los 2000 soles solicitados, algunas piezas que le hacen falta a su mototaxi, entre ellos telescópicas, llantas, aros, etc.
texts.en:
Rosa, 36, is the mother of three children.  Only one of them is now an adult and no longer dependent on her.  The two younger ones, however, still live with her in her own house where she and her husband are responsible for the children’s education.

Rosa is a woman who likes to be active.  Although she doesn’t have a regular job she’s always looking for something to do with her available time.  Her activity consists in leasing out mototaxis.  She now has three units thanks to her work that she started about five years ago approximately.  She tells us that her husband helps her since he’s in charge of one of the mototaxis and she leases out the other two.

What she most likes about her work is that she always has extra income since she has time available and she also feels that the other two units produce well since they are operated by responsible people who don’t damage them.  Rosa is thinking about being able to buy a few more units because she’d like to enlarge her fleet of vehicles.

This is Rosa’s third MFP loan.  She very much enjoys belonging to the group she’s in because she feels that everyone is responsible.  She hopes to use the requested 2000 soles to buy some replacement parts needed for her mototaxi.  Among them are: shock absorbers, tires, rims, etc.

loans.use: to buy some needed replacement parts for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Hoeung

texts.en:
The country of Cambodia operates as a free market, so lots of couples cooperate and make an effort to find jobs that are suitable for them to earn sufficient income to support their families. With many job choices, Hoeung works as a fish trader in a market near her own house, earning about 3 USD a day. Her husband works as a fisherman. Hoeung has four children whom she is presently supporting. 

Hoeung is requesting a 600 USD loan to improve her family’s standard of living. She will use her loan to purchase fishing equipment for her husband’s fishing business. In the future, she hopes to be able to send all of her children to universities.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 33 years old and married to a soldier whose salary is about 11,000 soms a month. She and her husband have two children, both of whom are n school. A year ago, Farida applied for a loan for 15,000 soms, which she used to go into the business of selling children's school uniforms. She earned enough money to pay back the loan while also opening her own stall in the local market. Now she is applying for her second loan to buy children's shoes and school uniforms to sell this fall. Her goal is to increase her income so that she can afford to buy a vehicle for her family to use. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and watch a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy children’s shoes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia, de 36 años convive con el padre de sus dos hijos en su casa propia, es una mujer alegre y sobre todo trabajadora que le gusta estar haciendo todo tipo de actividades para poder generar algún ingreso en su hogar.
Sonia tiene como trabajo el de la compra y venta de animales, esta actividad la esta realizando ya desde hace dos años. Ella se va a las chacras y caseríos alejados de la ciudad en busca de animales como patos, gallinas, cerdos, etc., para comprarlos y traerlos a vender a la ciudad, este trabajo es muy rentable ya que hay veces que se puede hasta duplicar la inversión de su dinero.Lo que no le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que ir sola además de dejar por días enteros a sus hijos. Sin embargo, lo que le gusta es que gana una buena cantidad de dinero y a veces también hay ocasiones en que puede ver a sus hijos días enteros. Hace poco ella empezó con una idea, el de ir a un lugar un poco alejado de la ciudad en donde sus familiares la convencieron de poder sacar oro de forma artesanal, así que ella espera poder incursionar en este negocio en las siguientes semanas.Este es el tercer préstamo entre Sonia y MFP, esta contenta pues agradece que le presten sin necesidad de tantos papeleos y sobre todo le enseñan a como poder utilizar de la mejor manera su dinero.Con el préstamo solicitado 1500 soles ella comprará materiales para la búsqueda de oro.
texts.en:
Sonia is 36, and lives with the father of her two sons in their own house. She is a cheerful woman, and above all hard-working.  She likes to be doing all types of work to be able to generate any income she can for the household.  Sonia buys and sells animals; work she has been doing for two years now.  She goes to the small farms and rural settlements far from the city, looking for animals such as ducks, chickens, pigs etc., to buy and bring to the city to sell.  

This work is very profitable, since there are times you can even double your investment.   What she doesn't like about her work is that she has to go by herself, and be away from her children for days at a time.  However, what she likes is that she earns a good amount of money and there are also times when she can spend whole days with her children.  

A little while ago, she decided to pursue a new idea, that of going to a place, some distance from the city, where her relatives have convinced her that she can extract gold through artisanal means.  So she is hoping to enter this business in the next few weeks. 

This is the third loan between Sonia and MFP. She is happy, and and thankful that they will give her a loan with less paperwork, and especially because they will teach her how she can use her money in the best way. With the loan of 1500 soles that she is applying for, she will buy materials needed to extract gold.

loans.use: To buy materials for her new activity of artisanal gold extraction

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Remy works hard to provide for the financial needs and basic needs of her family.

She has had a used clothing business for 2 years and she earns about P20,000 monthly. Due to high cost of basic commodities she would like to ask for a loan amounting to P20,000 to buy stock of used clothing to sell in her stall. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to be sell in her stall

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Lea is providing motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.
Lea is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lea hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for motorbike services

loans.name: Wendelyn

texts.en:
Wendelyn is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Wendelyn has a retail shop that sells clothes like t-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear for sale.
Wendelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Wendelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, blouses and underwear for sale

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Russel has a retail shop that sells party supplies, little toys and accessories. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of toys and party supplies.
Russel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Russel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of toys and party supplies for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is from the village of La Paz Saguday. She and her husband work hard on the family farm. The couple have been blessed with three children.

Juliet request a loan amount of P21,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticide and payment for the labor cost of transplanting of crops for farming business. She hopes that she could be able to improve her rice farming business to be able to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticide and to pay for labor of transplanting of crops for her farming business

loans.name: Junie

texts.en:
Junie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 7 children. 
Junie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.
Junie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Junie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Jentex

texts.en:
Jentex is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Jentex has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy blouses and t-shirts for sale.
Jentex is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jentex hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses and t-shirts for sale

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.en:
Cirilo is 56, married and father of five school aged children. His dream has always been for a successful of business and to uplift his family out of poverty. Cirilo is engage in hog raising business for more than 17 years. He does a lot of strategy to maintain it well and widen his business.
Cirilo is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He gives his best in managing the business just to feed his family and able to continue send his children in school and finish their studies. 
Cirilo knows that it is a big responsibility of the parent to be the head of the family which is why he is assuring to perform his responsibility and fulfill his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 10 children. 
Felicidad has a retail shop that sells green bananas. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy green amd yellow bananas for sale.
Felicidad is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Felicidad hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas for sale

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is an active lady who supports her family by doing embroidery for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work. She prepares beautiful looking embroidered clothes and earns good profits. Her husband is 45 years old and a janitor in the university.  Shamim has five children. All of them are studying in different classes and continuing their education. 

Shamim needs some capital to improve her embroidery business. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material in larger quantities that will allow her to fulfill the needs of her customers and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for the past three years and has good number of clients. She is confident that an investment will help her improve her sales and profits. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business

loans.name: Chou

texts.en:
Chou is 35 years old and is married with three lovely dependent children, all of whom are students. She lives permanently in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Chou works hard to support her family and never takes time to visit or talk freely with anyone else. She is always considering how to earn more cash for her family. Currently, she is a fish trader in a market near her community and earns around 3 USD daily. Her husband works as a fisherman. 

Chou would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial future of her family and is requesting a 500 USD loan from Kiva to purchase fishing equipment for her husband’s business. In the future, she hopes to send all of her children to study at university.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Maria Elena has a retail shop that sells used clothing like t-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing for sale.
Maria Elena is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Maria Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a retail shop where she sells chicken and hotdogs. Elsie is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional frozen foods to sell to her customers. She is a new member of HSPFI and is committed to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has one child and has earned a living for the last five years by running a retail shop where she sells snacks, noodles and canned goods. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. Evan is a new member of HSPFI, but is very committed to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sokneoun

texts.en: Sokneoun is 31 years old and and married to Sophear, who is 33. They have three sons, two of whom are old enough to attend school, and live along National Road No. 1 about 17 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh. Sokneoun earns a living by selling recycled materials while her husband works in construction. She is applying for her first loan, for $1,000, to do two things: buy a motorbike for her husband to using when commuting to work, and improve her home by adding a restroom.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and improve her home by adding a restroom.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun (in the photo) is 40 years old and her husband Hean is 50 years old. They live in a village along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children - two sons and three daughters. Two work for a restaurant, one is a construction worker and the other two are in school.  

Chhoeun stays at home and does house work. The main source of income is from her children and husband’s salary. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to renovate the house where she lives.

loans.use: To renovate the house where she lives.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en:
Many Cambodians make a living as farmers. One of them is Suong, 36, who has been working in this sector since 2005. Presently, she and her husband grow maize and potatoes on farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. Suong is able to generate a daily income of about 3 USD from her business. This humble couple has two dependent children, both of whom are in school. 

The couple planted maize during this growing season but it is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Therefore, Suong and her husband are requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase fertilizer to improve their field. The increase in income from her loan will help to improve the family’s standard of living. Suong is grateful to all of the lenders who are supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is a married man with four children who all attend school. He lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three months he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. His greatest monthly expense is high cost of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Janet has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.
Janet is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Janet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, single and lives with three family members. One of his family members works.

Alaa has been a tailor since 2006. He makes and repairs women and men’s clothing. He has a deep understanding of local consumer and he has a good experience. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1200 loan to purchase a tailoring machine and a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine and a generator.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. 

Adel has been an owner of an automotive workshop since 2004. He fixes and repairs all cars’ electrical problems.  He has good experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,200 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his workshop and to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with one child who is three years old. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Bakari dreams of expanding to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of  wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Merlibeth

texts.en:
Merlibeth is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 
Merlibeth has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, noodles and snacks.
Merlibeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Merlibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles and snacks

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is 29 years old and is single. He has been in the hog raising business for almost four years. Jayson is grateful for his business because he can help his parents pay their household costs through his earnings.
Jayson wanted to maintain his business to extend his financial assistance to his parents. He is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy additional piglets to raise in order to maintain his business. He believes that this loan is a big help for him as he continues to operates his business and generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda, 51, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, a cook, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Linda operates a coin bank manufacturing business. She buys raw materials used in coin bank production and processes it to produce colorful coin banks. Her finished products were distributed to markets, general stores and other places where she has contacts for her products where she earns a margin for every coin bank she delivers. She earns a minimum of Php7500 in profit every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy raw materials needed in coin bank production and other supplies for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Linda dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and she also hopes to tap more customers in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials to produce colorful coin banks

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Many Cambodians make their living as farmers. One of them is Phin, who is 44 years old and has been working in this sector since 1998. Currently, Phin and her husband grow rice on farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. Phin is able to earn about 2 USD per day. This humble couple has two children, one of whom is school-aged and another who works in a Phnom Penh factory as a garment worker and earns a low monthly salary. 

The couple planted rice during this growing season but it is not doing well due to crop disease and the lack of fertilizer. Because of this, Phin and her husband are requesting a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticide. Their increased income will improve the family’s standard of living. Phim is very thankful to all the lenders that help her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with two children, aged seven and two years. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past ten years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and theft because of insecurity in his area of operation. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Montazer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with four family members. One of his family members works.

Montazer has owned a bookstore since 2010. He has a photocopier machine and he sells stationery. He has a good reputation and his store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for an $1,800 loan to make a showcase and to buy a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To make a showcase and to buy a generator.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with four children. Three of her children attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is competition from other tailors in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, zip, buttons and threads. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth, zippers, buttons and thread.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. He lives with 11 family members. Two of the family members work.

Sadek has owned a store since 1995, selling women's clothing, accessories and cosmetics. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan to make a ceiling light for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole

loans.use: To make a ceiling light for his store.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Marichu has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy ready to wear clothing such as t-shirts and blouses.
Marichu is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marichu hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear clothing such as t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 39 years old. He is married to Mercy and they are blessed with a three year-old child. He has been operating a design and printing business for the past nine years and makes a monthly profit of KES.26,000. He has requested a KES.60,000 loan to purchase a HP computer and printer.

With his anticipated profits, he plans to buy a photo cleaning machine. He hopes to educate his child to high levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase a HP computer and printer

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, 45, is a single mother of three children, she runs a food stall (cooking and selling fries) business. She has been loaned KES.5,000 which she plans to use to purchase vegetables for sale (kale to diversify her business).

With her anticipated profits, she would like support her family financially and stabilize her vegetable business. In the future she would like to grow her business to and enjoy the profits made.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale (kale to diversify her business)

loans.name: Dos

texts.en: Mrs. Dos is 54 years old and married with 6 children. One of her children is married and lives in a separate house, the other 5 children are single. Mrs. Dos manages a farming business where she plants and harvests rice to both sell and provide food for her family. She is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to purchase fertilizer and herbicide to use to maintain her farm. She plans to improve her farming practices to increase her profits. Mrs. Dos says that this loan will help her to cope with the increase in commodity production nowadays and also uplift the living conditions of her family so they will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicide to use to maintain her farm

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 41 years old and married to Catherine. They have three school going children. He has practiced farming for eleven years. 
 
He was introduced to KADET by a field officer and this will be his second loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seed and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

In the future, Francis hopes to become a leading farmer in his area of residence.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business and add raw materials like carving wood and stones

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married and has one child.

Fatima has been an owner of a beauty salon since 2008. She has good experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumers. Her salon is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of people passing by. 

She decided to apply for a $3,000 loan to pay the annual rent for her salon. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for her salon.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Jennifer has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy blouses and underwear for sale.
Jennifer is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses and underwear for sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is Sabina, 48, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a salesman, and is mother to four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Sabina operates a Bamboo furniture business. She buys Bamboo furniture from a local supplier and sells them at her store. She offers Sala sets, Bed and Tables made from bamboo. She displays her stocks of bamboo furniture in a vacant lot for customers to see. Her customers usually come from the local community and nearby areas. She earns a minimum of Php3100 in profit every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new stocks of bamboo furniture. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sabina dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and she also hopes to grow her business in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of bamboo furniture for her business.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 30 years old, married to Mary and they have one child. He has operated in the transport industry for the last seven years. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan amount to repair his motorbike and also boost his farming project. 

In the future, he hopes to buy a pickup truck which he will use to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and boost his farming project

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 10 kilos of potatoes, 300 kilos of maize seeds,  2 kilos of chemical fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is a 32-year-old young woman. She is married and has three sons and one daughter. Mayson's husband works as a construction worker. Mayson and her husband have a poultry farm where they raise laying hens and broilers and sell the produce to shops in Jenin city where they live. 

Mayson wants to increase the family income as her children are growing up and their educational and life expenses are growing as well. Therefore, she thought of increasing the number of hens of both types on the farm and increasing the produce. Therefore, she took out a $3,000 loan from FATEN. 

Mayson and her husband are photographed at the poultry project.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer has been making metal boxes, jikos and other metal products for sale in Naivasha town for the last 22 years. She is 51 years old and a single mother of three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more raw materials for making jikos and boxes.

In future, Jennifer hopes to become a leading manufacturer and supplier of metal products in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making jikos and boxes

loans.name: Saheb

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has three children, one of whom works.

Saheb has been an owner of a coffee shop since 2005. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation. His coffee shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2,900 loan in order to renovate and fix his shop’s furniture and to purchase a generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his shop’s furniture and to purchase a generator.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Leah has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.
Leah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future,Leah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber and other raw materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. A 41-year-old mother of five school-going children, she is married to Jackson.

Agnes was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends, and this will be her first loan which she plans to use to purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting. She will later sell her produce at the local market. In the future, Agnes hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Dourgham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has two children. 

Dourgham has had a barber shop since 2005. He has good experience and a deep understanding of the local consumer. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,700 loan to buy an air conditioner and to renovate the furniture in his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy an air conditioner and to renovate the furniture in his shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. A 34-year-old mother of four school-going children, she is married to James.

Lucy was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her fourth loan. She paid all previous loans well and in good time. Lucy plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow to boost her farming income, and in the future hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay is a middle-aged woman, married to Long, age 48, and they both are living in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a hard-working farmer. Generally, Lay gets $2 as her profit each day. She works tirelessly in the field in order to support her family. Currently, she has 5 children, and they are all single. To help their parents, her daughter works as a local garment factory worker in Phnom Penh and another child is working as a local car polisher. Both of her children are low salary. Because of lack of money, Lay would like to request a loan from Kiva in the amount of 500 USD in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer and help plow the rice field. She says that the income will help her to improve her family's living standards. She is very thankful to all lenders that help her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer and help plow the rice field

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, who has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years, is 36 years old, married to Macharia, and the mother of four school-going children.

Agnes was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan, which she plans to use to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Agnes hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha, who is 31 years old, married to Peter and the mother of five children, has operated a retail shop for the last three years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her second loan with which she plans to buy more goods to sell in her shop.

In the future, Martha hopes to expand her business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Jadamba

texts.en:
Jadamba is a 29-year-old single man who operates a grocery store in one of the outer districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.
