He lives with his father and younger brother in a small house but decided this summer to run the business on his own property, which he had previously rented out.

Jadamba has also been running a taxi business for over six years with the car he bought based on a leasing contract. His brother, Ganjuur, makes his living from his own taxi business as well. Their mother passed away when they were little; because Jadamba was the oldest son, he had to work hard to get his family ahead.

Jadamba is now requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase a wide range of merchandise to sell in his grocery store. He wishes to provide a good quality of life to his brother and father as well as start his own life.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in his food store.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson has practiced maize farming and also keeps livestock in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 34 years old, married to Rebeccah, and they have two school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan with which he plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.  

He will later sell the produce at the local market. In the future, Evanson hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en: Maritha has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 41 years old, married to James, and they have four school-going children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Maritha hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 51 years old and is married with three children aged between 15 and 21 years old. She sells animals such as chickens and goats. Her business is well-organized. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 7 pm every day. She has five years experience in this business and she employs one person to help her. Alice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more animals to raise and sell. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and goats for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rodi

texts.en:
Rodi is a 52-year-old lady, married to Barnabas, who is 52 years old. They have seven children: Welmince, 32 years old, Mery, 30 years old, Asnat, 26 years old, Simon, 28 years old, Nusry, 17 years old, Victor, 13 years old and Stevie, 8 years old. Three of them are married and live with their families, while Nusry, Victor and Stevie are still at school.

Rodi is the breadwinner for her family. She had to take responsibility for their daily needs since her husband got sick 7 years ago. She and her husband used to work as farmers but his condition lead her to a kiosk business.  

Rodi commenced her business by selling betel nuts, betel vines and tobacco, as she only had a small amount of capital. She is dreaming to improve her business by adding detergent, coffee, tea, and rice as demanded by customers but does not have money to do so. She is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 and hopes that TLM will approve her application.

loans.use: To purchase detergent, coffee, tea, and rice for her kiosk.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and married to Sammy. She has practiced poultry farming for the last six years.   

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be her fourth loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more chicks for her poultry farm.

In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Nadera

texts.en:
Nadera is a hardworking, ambitious widow. Her husband passed away 20 years ago in a car accident on the same day her youngest daughter was born. On that day, Nadera was left with six children to raise.

Since she did have an educational background, Nadera started to prepare food for working mothers and be paid for it so she could survive with her family. Step by step, she was able to turn her small business into a catering business in Al Zarqa, have a whole new kitchen to work in, and send all of her kids into schools to get the best educational level they could have.

Going through what she experienced, Nadera decided to help more families by employing them in her catering business to support their families. Now Nadera has applied for a loan to expand her business and buy a delivery bus to be able to serve other cities like Amman.

loans.use: To buy a delivery bus

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years.  She is 50 years old and married to Richard. Together they have two children who attend school.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be her second loan. Lucy repaid her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 on time. She plans to use this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Lucy hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Hameda

texts.en:
Hameda is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and has four sons and two daughters, Hameda lives in Khan Younis city in Palestine. Hameda's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Hameda is has a backache that is caused by a problem with her spine.  Her husband can't afford to pay for the tests needed to diagnose the problem at once.  Hameda took out a loan from FATEN to cover the cost.

Hameda is a religious conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for health treatment expenses

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en: Mrs. Loeung, age 32, is a farmer and is married to Ros, age 36, who is a construction worker. Currently, they have 7 children and all of them are single. Her base income is from planting rice and she usually generates $2.50 each day. Mrs. Loeung is concerned that her land for planting rice is not enough, so she would like to request a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more land. She says that this loan is very useful for her family. She is thankful for your help. Mrs. Loeung is shown with her child.

loans.use: to purchase more land

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agnes has five children. Three of the children are in school. She is a married woman.

She has been in this business for four years. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business .She says that the extra income from this loan will help in building a small store for her business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has practiced farming in Olkaolou town for the last six years. He is 50 years old and married to Rachael. They have four children who attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be Joseph's fourth loan. He has repaid his previous loans on time. He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow which he hopes will boost his income.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Zainat

texts.en:
Zainat is a 25-year-old mother of two children. Her husband is a school teacher and they live in Al Karak.

Zainat wanted to help her husband support the family by doing something while she is at home taking care of the kids. She decided a year ago to start a small retail business selling home/kitchen tools and products at home such as pans, plates, trays, etc. 

Through this past year, Zainat was able to participate in raising their family's monthly income, which gives her a great feeling of being productive and helpful. Now she has applied for a loan to get more products to have most of the basic tools needed in a kitchen.

loans.use: to buy more of the basic kitchen tools to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon has been making bricks and building houses for people in Olkalou town for the last 10 years. He is 53 years old and married to Loyce. They have two children who attend school.                                                                                                                       .

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be Simon's third loan. He has repaid his previous loans on time. He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow so that he can diversify his sources of income.

In the future, Simon hopes to become a leading constructor in Olkalou and also to grow his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and has three sons and four daughters. Amani lives in Rafah city in Palestine.
Amani's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee, Amani wants to finish the construction of the family house they started years ago. Since her husband makes a decent salary and paying for the construction expenses will exhaust the family financially, she took out a $2,000 from FATEN to cover the expenses and have them repaid on a monthly basis to FATEN.

Amani is a religious conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To finish construction of the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Benkola I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA I sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne  43 ans, 6 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Klè, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées par ces femmes du groupe BENKOLA I sont le riz, le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, AWA  qui est la deuxième assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola I Group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have six children. They live in polygamous families in Klè, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice, millet and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Awa, the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. Awa expects to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 19 years old, just completed high school and has practiced dairy farming in Olkalou town for the last two years. He also buys and sells potatoes from farmers and sells them in the local market.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers--this will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 20,000 on time. He plans to use this loan to buy milk cans to deliver milk to his customers.

In the future, Joseph hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy dairy cans to deliver milk to customers

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en: After raising all of her kids to a point where they can take care of themselves, Etaf, a 50-year-old housewife, started to have a lot of free time for herself, which gave her the idea of starting a small home business selling make-up and accessories to the females in the area. Now Etaf is looking to bring in more types of accessories and cosmetics to her business so she can develop it and open her own store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more accessories and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last six years. He is 31 years old and married to Phylis. They have two children who attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be Peter's third loan. He repaid both of his previous loans on time. He plans to use this loan to buy ten lambs which he will raise and sell later for a profit.

In the future, Peter hopes to become a leading farmer in the Olkalou area.

loans.use: To buy ten lambs to raise and sell for profit

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated her beauty shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years. She is 31 years old and married to Godfrey. They have three children who attend school.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers. This will be Beatrice's first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more cosmetics and supplies for her beauty shop.

In the future, Beatrice hopes to open many branches of her beauty shop around town.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Thaera

texts.en:
Thaera is a 23-year-old young woman. She lives in the Biet Lahya area located in Palestine. Thaera has an educational center offering services such as translating documents, research guidance, etc. The center is located in an excellent part of the city center and attracts a good number of beneficiaries.

Thaera needs a professional multi-tasking copier but the price is too high to pay for it all at once from the center's regular income. Therefore, she took out a loan from FATEN to purchase it as the previous one is broken and can't be fixed.

Thaera is photographed at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase a copier

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
At the age of 46, Bonifacio has managed his hog-fattening business for one year. He is married with one child. His wife is a housekeeper who takes care of their child. Bonifacio's priority in life is to give his family a better life and lift them out of poverty.
Bonifacio is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed and piglets to raise. He is dedicated to his work. He works hard and manages his business well to ensure that he will someday reach his goal. 
Bonifacio also operates a tricycle for transportation services. His earnings from this business helps enable his child to go to school. The profits from his businesses pay for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 25-year-old college student who is studying to get his master degree in social studies at the university.

To be able to pay his school tuition, Hamzeh opened a small food market in his area where he sells snacks, juice, and other types of food products.

Now Hamzeh has applied for this loan to redecorate the store and fill it with more food products to get a higher profit out of it.

loans.use: To redecorate the store and fill it with more food products

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has practiced farming for the last four years. He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be John's third loan. He plans to use it to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rachid Abed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married, and has six children. 

A. has owned a store since 1995, selling all kinds of fish, both fresh and grilled. He has good experience,  a deep understanding of local consumers, and a good reputation. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for his store. He aims to make more money which will offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bedroom furniture

loans.name: Arseline

texts.en:
Arseline is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Arseline has a retail shop that sells food dishes like afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking more meals to sell.
Arseline is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Arseline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes for sale

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. Heng is 45 years old, married to Mr. Von and has four children. They make a living as farmers, using land which is located near their home. The couple has been doing this since 1980 and one of their children is now making a living as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh while the other works as an electrician. The other two children are both still in school. The couple earns about $3 a day. They work very hard and are applying for a $400 loan from Kiva to buy fertilizer, which they plan to scatter on their field during the coming rainy season. They will also use a portion of the loan to hire several people to help them plow their land. In the future, the couple would like to open a new business which will help them secure their financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to hire some people to help them with plowing.

loans.name: Abd Alrahman

texts.en:
Abd Alrahman is a 26-year-old man, who recently got married. 

Four years ago Abd Alrahman opened a shop to sell frozen goods such as meat, chicken, fish, etc. He even has the equipment to prepare the goods in any shape the customer wants (slices, chopped, etc.). And from his income, he was able to get married on his own and start a family. 

Now Abd Alrahman has applied for this loan in order to improve his store and open another branch in another area as an expansion of his business.

loans.use: to improve his store and open another branch to expand his business.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is 49 years old and married. Warlita has only one grown dependent. Warlita owns and operates a retail store at home to support her day-to-day needs. For 21 years, she has been able to manage the store properly. Every month she receives PHP 14,406 from her business undertakings. 

To pave her financial difficulty, Warlita joined GDMPC in 2007. The cooperative gives her the chance to access financial services. As a matter of fact, she already had drawn three loans, making this current loan application her fourth. Her loan this time is for PHP 10,000. This will be used to purchase daily use commodities to sell such as canned goods, spices, shampoo and more. With the probable revenue to gain, Warlita hopes to sustain further the livelihood and sell more products to increase the regular monthly income she receives.

loans.use: To purchase daily use commodities to sell such as canned goods, spices, shampoo and more.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Dolores has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods & beverages to sell.

Dolores is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dolores hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods & beverages to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is from Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines. She is 35 years old and married. She has school-aged children to take care of. To answer her day to day needs, Rosalie has engaged in a buy and sell type of business venture. For 7 years she has been acquiring several kinds of bananas to sell in the local community and in neighboring communities. This became a big part of her daily routines and because of this she makes about PHP 7,000 a month.

In 2009, Rosalie became an official member of GDMPC. For the 3rd time around, she has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from the cooperative to acquire several kinds of bananas to sell. She hopes to have enough revolving funds and to have enough business resources to maintain good sales.

loans.use: To acquire several kinds of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is a 54-year-old widowed man living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He has 7 grown children. Long before his wife died, the couple had been running a retail store. The store, operated and owned by the family, is in its 29th year of existence. Every month, he makes about PHP 7,400.

Earlier this year, Norberto joined GDMPC. He has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 which will be used to purchase grocery items to sell. Sustaining his livelihood is very important - much more now that he attends to his dependents' needs alone. By having the probable income to be generated from this loan, Norberto hopes to expand the extent of the business and never run out of stock in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Filomera

texts.en:
She has eight children, five of whom are in school. She is a married woman. 

Filomera has been in the business of selling breads, mandasi, and sapati for three years. She took a loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, breads, and flour

loans.name: Benkola Ii Group

texts.fr:
BENKOLA II est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Klè, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées par les femmes du groupe sont entre autres le riz, le dah, le niébé et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, SITAN la  deuxième assises à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectare de riz.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkola II Group are married women who, on average, are 45 years old and have five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Klè, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice, roselle, black-eyed peas and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Sitan, the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing. She has around 0.25 hectares of farmland to grow rice. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. Sitan expects to make an average profit of around 20,000 CFA francs by the end of the season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and to buy agricultural supplies and tools.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old, married to Mary, and they have one school-going child. He has practiced farming for the last three years.   

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zamirakhon

texts.ru:
Замирахон честная и целеустремленная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 6 детей. Её муж является трудовой мигрантом, и она сама занимается скотоводством. С детство она была знакома с данным бизнесом, потому что её отец занимался этим. Своевременно она научилась данным бизнесом и она изучала все тонкие стороны этого бизнеса. Она решила начинать этот бизнес для того чтобы обеспечит свою семью так как у неё большая семья и не хватает денег на обеспечение её 6 детей. Замирахон хотела бы получит кредит в размере 1500$ США для покупки 2 скота и приобретение пресс-люцерна 165 шт. Она заранее благодарна всем за поддержку и милосердие.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Zamirakhon is an honest and goal-oriented woman. She is married and the loving mother of six. Her husband is a migrant worker, and she herself raises farm animals. She is familiar with this line of work since her childhood this is what her father used to do. She learned this work early on and studied its various finer aspects. She decided to launch this business in order to support her family  since she has large and there are not enough funds to provide for her six children. Zamirakhon would like to receive a loan of 1,500 USD to buy two heads of cattle and 165 units of pressed lucerne feed. She thanks everyone in advance for their support and charity.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy two heads of cattle and 165 units of pressed lucerne feed

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 31-year-old mother who has two sons; she is married to Ahmad who has a store that sells cleaning products. 

It has been almost three years since the store opened, and now Majeda wants to help her husband include other products beside cleaning products, that's why she has applied for this loan. 

Since Majeda is a conservative person, she preferred that her husband Ahmad appears in the picture instead.

loans.use: To include more cosmetics products in her husband's store

loans.name: Romulino

texts.en:
Romulino is 46 years old. He is a single man dealing with his 2 grown children. The family is living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. While not the only means of income, Romulino has engaged in raising domestic animals - swine, in particular. He has been feeding, cleaning and taking good care of these animals for 2 years. He sells the grown ones to swine buyers for a good price. Every month, he normally receives about PHP 22,920.

Earlier this year, Romulino joined GDMPC. He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 from the organization to purchase swine for fattening and materials to repair their shelter.  Romulino hopes to sell the current raised pigs at a higher price and have more piglets to grow later.

loans.use: To purchase swine for fattening and materials to repair their shelter.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old, married to Beth, and they have three school-going children. He has been buying and supplying milk around Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eight years.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more milk for resale.

In future, John hopes to grow his business and become one of the leading suppliers of milk in his area.

loans.use: To buy more milk for resale.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. He is married with 2 legitimate school-aged dependents. Joven is a man who has an intense desire to grow a variety of lovely flowers. He has been gardening for 3 years. He propagates several types of flowers because, aside from generating an income, they can also beautify and create a healthy environment. By selling fully grown flowers, Joven makes about PHP 6,962 a month.

Earlier this year, Joven joined GDMPC. He has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase manures, insecticides and pesticides to prolong the plants' capacity to live. Good soil for satisfactory growth is relevant for plants. Joven hopes to produce the best flowers and sell in exchange for a good price. He plans to expand the garden area to plant more.

loans.use: To buy manures, insecticides and pesticides to prolong the plants' capacity to live.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng is 28 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1988, she has worked as a farmer and she also weaves mats to earn additional income. Leng earns 2 USD daily from her work. She is married to Van, who sells metal, and so far the couple has three dependent children. 

Leng is requesting a Kiva loan to buy rice seed and plow her field as it is planting season and she lacks money. In the future, she hopes to renovate her house and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and cultivate her field

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and deals with her 2 school-aged children. In her 13 years of married life, Genevieve has allowed herself to discover her capability to raise domestic animals, particularly pigs - making it a central source of income for the family. Every month, she makes about PHP 15,140.

Earlier this year, she joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 from the cooperative to purchase pig food for nourishment for fast growth. Genevieve hopes for prosperous years of business undertakings. She plans to buy more piglets to grow and eventually sell to make good cash inflow.

loans.use: To purchase pig food for fast growth.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is married and her husband is involved in a livestock business. He gets milk from his cattle and sells it to the milk shops and community people. He also sells animals such as buffaloes and goats to customers who require them and earns a good profit.  

Sakina is very skillful. On a part-time basis, she sews clothes for her neighborhood clients.  She is the mother of five children. Two of them study while the others stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy some more animals to sell after raising them. He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Sakina hopes that an investment will be a productive one for him and it will improve the living standard of her family as a result.

loans.use: To buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 45 years old and married. She is living in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines, with her 2 grown dependents. Marlyn has been cultivating land for a living. She is planting corn on it all year round to gain an income for the family. Based on her previous production, Marlyn was able to make an approximate income of PHP 6,000 a month.

Earlier this year, Marlyn joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 from the cooperative to purchase corn fertilizers and pay for their application. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to sell it for a profit. Marlyn further hopes that she can expand the area cultivated to plant other crops.

loans.use: To purchase corn fertilizers and pay for their application.

loans.name: Benkola Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA III est constitué de  10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames à Klè, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont essentiellement le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOUMATA la deuxième assises à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,25 hectares de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The group called BENKOLA III is made up of 10 married women who have an average age of 38 and on average, four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Klè, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 
.
They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are essentially rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, FATOUMATA, the second from the left, seated, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment, and pay plowing fees to maintain around 0.25 hectares of rice and peanuts. 

The produce is sold in the village marketplace and in the markets of Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. They expect to make an average profit of 20,000 F CFA per crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small equipment.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 59 years old and married. She has two adult children, one of whom is working abroad. At her age, Emelita still needs to work hard, and manages her hog raising business as a source of income. Her husband is a farmer, and at the same time he runs another business of repairing different damages to cars.

Emelita wants to borrow additional capital to maintain and continue operating her business. She plans to use the loan to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. She will do her best to improve any business she may have someday, in order to be a successful borrower and entrepreneur at the same time.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 41 years old, married to Kamau, and they have two school-going children. She has practiced farming for the last six years.  She is also building rental houses to supplement her farming income. 

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and materials to continue building the rental houses.

In future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in her area and also build more houses for rent, translating to more income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and also buy materials for building rental houses.

loans.name: Benkola Iv Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de dix femmes mariées, les membres du groupe BENKOLA IV ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Klè, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, FATOU, la deuxième assise à gauche, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues sur place au marché du village, au niveau du marché de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. FATOU compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.000 F CFA environs  en fin de fin.
texts.en:
Made up of ten married women, the group called BENKOLA IV has an average age of 34 and on average, four children. They live in polygamous families in Klè, one of the villages of the rural community of Banco,  Dioïla prefecture,  Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops cultivated are, among others, rice and peanuts. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso for the first time. 

With this loan, FATOU, seated second from the left, intends to buy farm inputs, small equipment and pay for plowing and weeding to maintain about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.  

Their crops are sold in the marketplace of their own village and at the markets of Banco and N’Golobougou, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. FATOU expects to make an average profit of 50,000 F CFA  more or less at the end of the crop season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, weeding, farm inputs, and small equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and employ laborers

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Farming is the most important part of 43-year-old Keo’s daily work and she has been a farmer since 1979.  She and her husband have three kids who are all school-aged. To improve family’s living situation, Keo’s husband works as a construction worker in the village. She and her husband can earn a daily profit of 4 USD. 

It is planting season, Keo wants to buy rice seed and plow her field. She lacks the money to do this and is requesting a Kiva loan. Keo says that this loan will be very useful for her family. In the future, she hopes to improve her house and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and cultivate her field

loans.name: Filomera

texts.en: Filomera has six children, four of whom are in school. She is married. She is 28 years old. She has a business selling soda and maize flour in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. She will use the profits to build another store for her business

loans.use: to purchase more soda and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 60 years old, married to Esther, and they have six school-going children. He has practiced farming for the last thirty years.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of his friends and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a calf which he will rear and hope to milk later.

In the future, Samuel hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en: Dilovar is a hardworking and responsible man. He is married and the father of 3 children. He is engaged in a farming business. He cultivates vegetables then sells them at the market. Dilovar wants to improve his living condition and increase his working capital. Dilovar would like to get a loan of 1,100 USD for purchasing seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants in order to get a good harvest and make a profit. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy inputs, groundnut seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years.  He is 39 years old, married to Margaret, and they have four school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow to boost his income.

In future, Paul hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and make use of workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Marjelyn

texts.en:
Marjelyn is a 38-year-old married woman. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is taking good care of her five school-aged dependents. 

Her source of income comes from gardening. She started planting crops one year ago. In her first year of production, Marjelyn has made an approximate PHP 1,500 a month.

Earlier this year, she joined GDMPC. She has applied a loan of PHP 10,000 from the cooperative to pay for land preparation costs. The area should be free from weeds before planting so the plants can absorb enough nutrients from the soil. Marjelyn hopes to grow more crops such as string beans, squash, tomatoes, etc.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation costs.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years.  He is 52 years old, married to Catherine, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD  by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Michael hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has three children. 

Haydar has been an owner of a workshop since 2005 where he repairs cars. He has a lot of experience, a good reputation, and he is well known in his area. 

He decided to apply for an $1800 loan to purchase an automatic lift jack and to make an outdoor ceiling for his workshop. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase an automatic lift jack and to make an outdoor ceiling for his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase urea and peanut seeds, and to hire workers to help with plowing and hoeing

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 40 years old, married to Jane, and they have two school-going children. He has practiced farming for the last eleven years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married, and has one child. 

Majed has been an owner of a cafeteria since 2009, where he prepares all kinds of food and drinks. He has a lot of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local consumers, and his cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for an $1800 loan in order to renovate and fix his cafeteria's ceiling, doors, and floor. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and fix his cafeteria’s ceiling, doors, and floor.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, 25 years old, has been selling movies and DVDs for the last three years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more movies and DVDs for sale.

In future, he hopes to grow his business and be a leading supplier of movies in his area.

loans.use: To re-stock his shop.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de  6 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Médina coura de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
A cause des problèmes familiaux dans son enfance, elle a prématurément abandonné l’école pour rapidement embrasser les activités génératrices de revenus depuis son jeune âge qu’elle a appris auprès de sa maman. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par se  consacrer uniquement à l’achat vente du bois de chauffe il y a 3 ans. Le bois de chauffe est l’un des éléments essentiels pour les femmes Maliennes  dans la  préparation des aliments (cuisine). Fatoumata peut vendre 1 chargement de camion remorque par mois.   
Pour  pouvoir combattre les ruptures de stocks et satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle n’a pas pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis 6 ans.  Après 5 prêts de groupe dans une association et 4 prêts individuels, qui ont été tous payés correctement, elle est à son  5 eme   prêt  individuel. 
Madame Fatoumata envisage utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat d’un chargement de camion remorque en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans d’un village  environnant  de Koutiala  et elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte à Médina coura, en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit.   Fatoumata compte réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000 FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement du prêt, satisfaire le besoin  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is 41 years old, married, and a mother of six.  She lives with her husband, her co-wife and their children in the Médina Coura district of the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region).  Due to family problems in her childhood, she dropped out of school early.  From a young age, she quickly adopted income-generating activities that she had learned from her mother.  Three years ago, after running a few unsuccessful businesses, she started working exclusively in firewood sales.  Firewood is a critical element for women in Mali when they cook food.  Fatoumata can sell a full semi trailer load in a month.

She wasted no time in joining the Soro Yiriwaso MFI six years ago, with the goal of preventing out-of-stocks and meeting her customers’ needs.  After five group loans with an association and four individual loans, which were all paid back normally, she is now on her fifth individual loan.

Fatoumata plans on using this loan to purchase a semi trailer load of firewood from farmers in the nearby village of Koutiala.  She sells retail in front of her home in Médina Coura, for cash and sometimes on credit.  Fatoumata expects to make a profit of 80,000 CFA francs per month, which she will use to pay back her loan and meet her family’s needs, with any remaining funds being invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Âgé de 27 ans, célibataire et père d’un enfant, Monsieur Oumar vit  chez parents dans le quartier Médina coura de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Oumar, pour des raisons sociales n’a pas pu continuer les  études primaires, et très vite embrassa les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son père. Depuis maintenant 3 ans  Oumar est installé à son propre compte.  Il est très sollicité et apprécié par ses clients, car le téléphone portable est de nos jours une nécessité majeure pour la population Malienne. 
Dans le souci de satisfaction de sa clientèle, Monsieur Oumar a fait recours à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il n’ y a que 2 ans. Il est à son troisième prêt  individuel et les deux prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté.  Avec ce financement  il compte acheter, 10 téléphones portables et des pièces de rechange à Bamako, il effectue sa vente dans son kiosque situé à Médina coura aux abords de route goudronnée, à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Avec ce financement, il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour subvenir à ses besoins et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Dans les jours à venir, il ambitionne d’agrandir son activité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
Oumar is 27 years old, single and a father of one, living with his parents in the Médina Coura district of the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region).

Due to social circumstances, Oumar wasn’t able to continue past elementary school, and he was quick to pursue other income-generating activities with his father.  For three years, Oumar has been self-employed.  He is very sought-out and appreciated by his customers, because cell phones are a major necessity for people in Mali today.

Oumar turned to the Soro Yiriwaso MFI only two years ago, hoping to better satisfy his customers.  He is currently on his third individual loan, and his previous two loans were paid back without any problems.  With this loan, he plans on purchasing 10 cell phones, as well as spare parts, in Bamako.  He sells for cash to a varied clientele from his stall in Médina Coura, along the paved road.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs.  He will use this to cover his needs, and invest any remaining funds back into his business.

In the future, he hopes to grow his business to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase cell phones and spare parts

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old and married. 

Ali has been an owner of a bookstore since 2010. He has good experience, a good reputation, and is well known in his area. 

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan to enlarge his store and to purchase a computer and photocopier. He aims to make more money to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To enlarge his store and to purchase a computer and photocopier.

loans.name: 10.1 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hòa is engaged in transportation service. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Hòa is 34 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 10.1 Đông Vệ solidarity group. Hòa lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hòa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hòa has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Hòa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hòa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile to do transportation service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Âgé de 42 ans et né à Safebougou, Monsieur  Adama est marié à une épouse et est père de 7 enfants. Il habite dans le quartier Médina coura de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso) avec sa famille. 
Du à des problèmes sociaux il n’a pas pu continuer les études primaires et s’est très vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus depuis son enfance auprès de son père. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, il finit par opter pour  la vente de poissons fumés  il y’a 14 ans. Les poissons fumés sont  très prisés à Koutiala.  
Afin d’augmenter son fonds de commerce et renforcer sa capacité de vente, il décida de  rejoindre  l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a bientôt une année. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel  et le précédent a été bien remboursé. 
Monsieur Adama compte acheter, 5 paniers de poissons fumés à Korientzé (Région de Mopti) auprès des  pêcheurs d’ethnie  Bozo  et  Somonô avec ce financement et effectue sa vente au  marché de poissons de Koutiala  à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’ hommes  au comptant, en détail et à crédit. 
Adama compte  réaliser un bénéfice de 120.000FCFA par mois qu’il utilisera  pour  le remboursement du prêt de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire ses besoins  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama was born in Safebougou. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of seven children. He lives with his family in the district of Medina Coura, prefecture of Koutiala (in the Sikasso region).

Social issues having prevented him from pursuing his primary studies, he quickly became interested in income-generating activities as a child alongside his father. After attempting several activities without success, he started selling smoked fish 14 years ago. Smoked fish are in high demand in Koutiala.

In order to bolster his working capital and strengthen his selling power, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso nearly a year ago. This is his second individual loan with the MFI; the first one was repaid without incident. 

With this loan, Mr. Adama plans to buy five baskets of smoked fish in Korientzé (in the Mopti region) from fishermen of Bozo and Somonô ethnic backgrounds. He conducts his sales at retail at the fish market of Koutiala for cash or credit. His clientele consists of both men and women.

Mr. Adama expects to earn 120,000 FCFA per month, which he will use to repay the loan to Soro Yiriwaso and pay for family expenses. Any remainder will be reinvested in his activity.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 69 years old, married and lives with his wife who works.

I. has owned a workshop since 1991, selling iron objects. He has a good experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan to renovate and repair his shop’s floor. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate and repair his shop’s floor.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 26 years old, married to Kimani, and they have two school-going children. She has practiced farming for the last eleven years.
  
She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 40 years old, married and has two children.

Since 1983, Ali has been an owner of a workshop where he repairs cars. He has more than twenty years' experience and has a good reputation and he is becoming well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2000 loan in order to purchase a sewing machine for leather and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for leather and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 46 years old, married to Esther, and they have four school-going children. He has practiced farming for the last fifteen years. 
 
He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: 11.1 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sang has a manufacturing business making wine. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Sang is 47 years old and she is married with two children. Sang is the group leader of the 11.1 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. Sang lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sang's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Sang has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Sang faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Sang hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make wine.

loans.name: C4916 Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Christophe is 54 years old and is married with four children aged between 3 and 25 years old. He is also the leader of this group which is called "ABANYAMURAVA". The group contains six men. 

Christophe employs three people to help him and he has five years of experience. His business is open from 6am to 9pm every day.

Christophe and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated her retail business for the last six months.  She normally sells her goods outside her house.She is twenty-four years old, single, and the mother of one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to pay rent and move into a more permanent place from where to sell.

In future, she hopes to grow her retail shop to wholesale.

loans.use: To pay rent and move to a more permanent place.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old, married to Ngumi, and they have five school-going children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last twenty-one years.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: 11.2 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hiếu works in agriculture where she raises poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Hiếu is 33 years old and married with one child. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 11.2 Đông Vệ solidarity group. Hiếu lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. This is Hiếu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hiếu has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hiếu faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Hiếu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattler to raise and sell

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single and lives with three family members.

Wissam has been an owner of a farm for rearing calves and cows since 2005. He inherited this farm from his father where he worked with him since he was child so he gained a good experience and a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is becoming well known in his area.

He is requesting $3000 loan to make a fence for his farm and to buy cattle feed. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a fence for his farm and to buy cattle feed.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: Mamlakat is an honest and hardworking woman. She is married and the loving mother of 3 children. Mamlakat sells woman’s clothes and fabrics at the local market. She always hopes that she will make a good profit and make her living conditions better. For this purpose, every day she works harder than the previous day. She meets her clients with a smile and serves her clients with great relish. She applied for a loan of 3,000 USD for expanding her business and increasing the range of merchandise. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy woman’s clothes and fabrics

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 39 years old and married to John. They have five school-going children. She has practiced farming for the last seven years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 30 years old. She is married to Jeremiah and they have two children. She has operated her food stall for the last two years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more cooking fat and wheat flour in bulk.

In the future, she hopes to grow her food stall into a decent-looking food joint.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking oil in bulk.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 46 years old, married to Ruth and they have five children. He has been buying and selling cereals for the last nine years. He transports the cereals around town on his motorcycle. 
 
He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He paid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy more cereals to sell.

In the future, he hopes to grow and become a leading supplier of cereals in his town.

loans.use: To buy more cereals to sell

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 29-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. Hanan lives in Jabalia refugee camp located in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

Hanan wants to renew her home furniture. Since her husband earns a decent salary, she needs to take a loan of amount $1,000 from FATEN. Hanan needs to change the furniture because when she got married, her husband wasn't able to purchase bedroom furniture or a kitchen table and he borrowed them from parents and friends. Now that Hanan heard about FATEN loans and realized it would be easier to repay in smaller amounts, her problem was solved.

Hanan is a religious conservative woman. Her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To pay for new home furniture.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 47 years old, single and the mother of one child.  She has operated her retail shop for the last 11 years.

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more dry foodstuffs to sell in her retail shop.

In the future, Grace hopes to grow and expand her retail shop to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more dry foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a grocery business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the dry hot season when the availability of vegetables for sale is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 43 years old, has practiced small-scale farming for the last three years. He sells his produce at the local market.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his third loan. He plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Al-Zahraa

texts.en:
Al-Zahraa is a 21-year-old woman who is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Palestine and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Al-Zahraa wants to purchase bedroom furniture for her children, as the children sleep on mattresses currently, therefore she took out a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. 

Al-Zahraa is a conservative religious woman, so her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture for her children.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three girls who all attend school. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six months, Mariam has operated a café business and her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenge is seasonality.

Mariam decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a 15,000 KES loan to purchase bags of beans, sugar, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil. Mariam's dream for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 27-year-old woman who is married and has one son and three daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. 

Fatema wants to purchase bedroom furniture for her three daughters, as they are growing up and need to have their own room, but with the salary her husband makes she can't pay the entire amount at once, therefore she borrowed $3,000 from FATEN. 

Fatema is a conservative religious woman, so her husband is photographed instead at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Ndamu

texts.en:
Ndamu is a married man with seven children, one of whom still attends school. He lives in a rented house without electricity or running water and his greatest monthly expense is food for his family. For the past 10 years, Ndamu has operated a cashew-nut selling business, selling cashews to his neighbors and passersby. His major business challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Ndamu is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. In the future, Ndamu dreams of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Dufatanye Bategarugori Group

texts.fr: Rachel  est agricultrice, elle membre du groupe Dufatanyebategarugori. Elle est mariée, elle est  âgé de 40 ans. Elle a  4 enfants entre 6 ans et  22 ans, et 3 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle est né au  Rwanda.son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser le prêt pour acheter 100kgs de pommes de terre, 10kgs de maïs tous pour les semences, 50kgs d’engrais chimique, et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire  est d’augmenter les nombres des champs pour satisfaire les marches. Dans l’avenir il voudrait être  une grande agricultrice connue dans sa région, elle voudrait payer les frais d’études supérieurs pour ses enfants, et bâtir  une autre maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Rachel is a farmer. She is a member of the group Dufatanye Bategarugori. She is married and 40 years of age. She has four children between six and 22 years of age, and three of her children attend school. 

Rachel was born in Rwanda. She finished six years of primary school. This is her second loan with ACB. She intends to use the loan to buy 100 kilos of potatoes, 10 kilos of maize for planting, 50 kilos of chemical fertilizer, and pay for labor. 

Her strategy for growing her business is to increase the number of fields she plants to satisfy the market. In future she would like to be an important farmer, well-known in her region. She would like to pay school fees for higher education for her children and build another house for her family.

loans.use: to buy 100 kilos of potatoes, 10 kilos of maize for sowing, 50 kilos of chemical fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: 11.3 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Tứ is 60 years old and married with three children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Tứ is the leader of a five-member group known as the 11.3 Đông Vệ Solidarity Group. For the past 10 years, she has run a wine-making business. The main business hardship that Tứ faces is the lack of capital.

Tứ is requesting a loan to purchase materials and ingredients to make wine and invest in her business. This will be Tứ’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Tứ hopes for her business to do well, her family to be healthy and happy, and for children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase material to make wine

loans.name: Suhaila

texts.en:
Suhaila is a 54-year-old woman, she is married and has one son. Her husband owns a store that sells mobile phones which is located in an area of high population with high demand for these products. Suhaila's husband wants to expand his business; he thought of adding mobile phones accessories and spare parts. 

Suhaila's husband doesn't have enough money in cash now, therefore she took out a loan from FATEN to help her husband pay the entire amount needed. 

Suhaila is a conservative religious woman, so her husband is photographed in the store.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones for the store.

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.ru:
Убайдулло порядочный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец 3 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как морковь, кукурузы и разные виды фруктов. Он занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет и у него хороший опыт, чтобы расширить этот бизнес.  Убайдулло всегда хотел, чтобы его дети выросли хорошими людьми, стали образованными и культурными человеками. С этой целью он старается зарабатывать много денег, чтобы обеспечить все потребности и нужды своих детей. Чтобы все-все его мечты осуществились ему необходимо достаточный капитал, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и покупать минеральных удобрений, семена и горюче- смазочные материалы. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Ubaidullo is a decent and honest man. He is married and is the responsible father of three children. He is involved in growing crops, such as carrots, corn and different kinds of fruit. He has been involved in this work for seven years and he has good experience in order to grow this business. Ubaidullo always wanted his children to grow up to be good people, to become educated and cultured folk. With this goal, he tries to make a lot of money to meet all the needs of his children. In order for all his dreams to come true, he needs enough capital to grow his business and to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, oil and lubricants. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
