But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds, oil and lubricants.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 34-year-old man who is married and has one son and two daughters. He lives in the Jabalia Refugee Camp in Palestine. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee. Khalil was able to save up a good amount and needs $500 that he took out from FATEN to purchase bedroom furniture. 

FATEN's loan will help Khalil purchase the furniture he needs and not exhaust him financially as it is repaid a small amount at a time. 

Khalil is photographed at FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Mena Iv Group

texts.en:
This photo shows the members of the “Mena IV” group, comprised of small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The leader of this group is Jatu, who is approximately 52 years old and married to a lorry driver. The couple has five children, one of whom attends primary school. For many years, Jatu has been selling housewares such as cooking pots, spoons, bowls and other items.  

The group is seeking a loan of 2,400,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, each member will be able to expand her business, make more profit, and consequently improve her standard of living. With her share of this loan, Jatu is going to buy cooking pots and eating bowls in large quantity to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking pots and eating bowls to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Julienne est mariée et mère de 5 enfants, tous scolarisés et évoluant bien dans leurs études. La relation réside chez son mari avec sa petite famille. Les charges financières du ménage reviennent au couple. 
Julienne est couturière de formation; parallèlement, elle vend des savons liquide, des cartes de recharges GSM, des boissons de la SOBEBRA, de la glace et du bissap, une boisson rafraichissante de fabrication locale très appréciée des enfants et même des grandes personnes. Pour disposer de revenus consistants, Julienne a ajouté à toutes ces activités la vente de nourriture. Elle a une large clientèle constituée des ménages de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle fait ses achats dans le plus grand marché du Bénin, Tokpa. 
Julienne est à son 2ème crédit qu'elle a sollicité et obtenu à FINADEV pour accroître son fonds de commerce afin de mieux diversifier son activité. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra d'être indépendante financièrement et de couvrir les charges familiales.
texts.en: Julienne is married and the mother of five children who are all in school and doing well in their studies. Our client resides with her husband and her small family. Household expenses are the couple's responsibility. Julienne is a seamstress by training; concurrently she sells liquid soap, rechargeable GSM phone cards, beverages from SOBEBRA, ice, and bissap, a refreshing beverage made locally (from hibiscus flowers) and very popular with children and even adults. To have substantial revenues, Julienne has included with all these businesses the sale of food. She has a large customer base composed of households in and around her area. She makes her purchases at Tokpa, the largest market in Benin. She is now on her second loan which she requested and obtained at the micro-finance institution FINADEV to increase her business capital in order to diversify her businesses further. The extra revenues generated by this micro-loan will enable Julienne to be financially independent and to cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen of liquid soap, 50 GSM rechargeable phone cards, and 25 cases of beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Togoo

texts.en:
Togoo is 48 and married with a daughter. She lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent. Togoo’s husband runs a taxi business and her daughter is an assistant singer at the local opera. Togoo’s family moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in 1997, and since then she has been selling handmade clothing from a retail stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. Before moving to the city, Togoo worked as a pre-school teacher in the province of Töv, Mongolia. 

Togoo sells her handmade clothes along with products imported from Beijing, China. With the business profit she has made in the last few years, her family bought a land plot in 2007. Togoo’s long-term goal is to build a new small house on her land where her family can enjoy a better living standard. 

Togoo is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase material she needs to make more clothes for autumn. Her dream is to open her own boutique and to see her daughter become a great opera singer. Togoo is very thankful to the lenders who are showing such generosity and giving her an opportunity to make a change in her life.

loans.use: to purchase material to make clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pouches of mineral water

loans.name: Badamragchaa

texts.en:
Badamragchaa is 28 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her husband works as a supervisor at local company and her three-year-old son attends a local kindergarten. 

Badamragchaa supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. She sells wide range of children's clothing imported from Beijing and Ereen, the border city of China. With the business profits she made since 2005, she managed to buy a small plot of land in 2008. 

Her aim for this year is to build a new small house on the land where her family can enjoy better living conditions. 

Badamaa is requesting a 1,500,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to import more children's clothing for the upcoming season. She says, "I love to see kids feeling overjoyed when they buy new clothes". 

She is planning to start the building project this August and is working hard to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to import more children’s clothing for the upcoming season

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Farming is the most important part of 30-year-old Run’s daily work and she has been a farmer since 1999.  She and her husband have two kids who are both school-aged. To improve the family’s living situation, Run’s husband works as a sugar-palm tree climber in the village. Run and her husband can earn a daily profit of 3 USD. 

It is planting season, and Run and her husband want to buy rice seed and fertilizer to cultivate their field. They lack the money to do this, and are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders. Run says that this loan will be very useful to her family. In the future, she hopes to improve her house and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Odbaatar

texts.en:
Odbaatar is 40 years old and lives with his wife, daughter, and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family lives in a small house in the outer districts of the city and both his son and daughter attend a local secondary school. For over 15 years, Odbaatar has been operating a clothing stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. He mostly sells children’s clothing and products imported from Beijing and Ereen, a border city of China. 

Odbaatar runs his business with working capital of 3,000,000 MNT. His general income is usually high and he makes 50% profit from his business. His family bought a plot of land in 2003 with his earnings and Odbaatar also managed to buy a used car in 2009.

Odbaatar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to import more clothes to sell in the autumn. His goal is to support his children’s education and provide them with good living conditions in the future. Odbaatar is pleased to have this opportunity to expand his business with assistance from Kiva lenders, to whom he is very thankful.

loans.use: to import clothes to sell for autumn

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 50-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. He has been working as a professional taxi driver for the past 20 years. In 2009, he bought a car and proceeded with his business operation independently. Despite his old age, he works hard to satisfy his family needs. Today, he is asking to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his car. At his age, finding a job is such a difficult mission, so his car represents his only source of income. In the future, he is hoping to earn a higher income to be able to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to recruit labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: One Love Group

texts.en:
This photo shows the members of the “One Love” group, comprised of small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The leader of this group is Sinnah, who is 28 years old and married with two children who attend primary school. She was born in Makeni and her husband is a businessman. For the past five years, Makeni has been selling locally dyed cloth called gara lappers. 

This is the first loan the One Love group is requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and improve their living standards. Sinnah will use her portion of the loan to buy wholesale materials, such as white cotton cloth, ink, caustic soda, powder and other items, so that she can produce and sell dozens of gara lappers.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce and sell locally dyed cloth

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en: Najwa is a 47-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living with her two children. She specializes in preparing delicious homemade food, which she sells to customers from her community. She has been involved in this type of business since 2006. In parallel, she works in a local hospital in order to earn superior income. She has been working so hard to support her family, especially after the death of her husband. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new oven and renew her cooking tools. In the future, she would like to rent out a small space to sell her popular homemade food products.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven and renew her cooking tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Nasukhidin

texts.ru:
Насухидин активный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Насухидин старается быть хорошим отцом, чтобы он мог всегда обеспечить все потребности своих детей и обучит их  в престижную школу и университетах.  Для этого он выбрал транспортные услуги и более 5 лет занимается этим. Этот бизнес приносят ему стабильный доход, который он тратят их на содержание своей семьи. Насухидин хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1500$ США на приобретение запчастей и ремонт автомашины, который позволить ему расширить свой бизнес и получит желаемый прибыль.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Nasukhidin is an active and hardworking man. He is married and has four children. Nasukhidin tries to be a good father so that he can always provide for all the needs of his children and will be able to send them to prestigious schools and universities. To this end, he chose transport services and has been engaged in this work for more than five years. This business provides him a stable income, that he spends on supporting his family. Nasukhidin would like to receive a loan in the sum of US $1,500 for spare parts and repairs for his vehicle, which allows him to expand his business and get the desired profit.

And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. loans.use: to acquire spare parts and repair his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.fr:
Veuve, Mélanie vit en location avec son unique enfant dont elle supporte la totalité des charges.
Dotée d'une expérience d'au moins 17 ans, la cliente est spécialisée dans la vente des sacs de charbon et des bois de chauffage qu'elle cède le plus souvent à crédit à ses clients moyennant paiement d'acomptes; la récupération des fonds se fait progressivement au quotidien. Elle a une large clientèle constituée des petits détaillants et des ménages de sa zone et de ses environs. Les sacs de charbon et les bois lui sont livrés à domicile par les grossistes ayant reçu l'agrément de commercialiser les produits forestiers. 
Après des ventes Mélanie ne se sent plus en mesure de satisfaire les nouvelles demandes de ses clients, raison pour laquelle elle à décidé renouveler son micro crédit afin d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement. Une partie du revenu supplémentaire sera réinvestie dans son commerce pour son renforcement et le reste lui permettra de subvenir à toutes les besoins de son enfant orphelin de père et à ses besoins personnels.
Elle est actuellement à son 7ème crédit à FINADEV.
texts.en:
Mélanie is a widow renting a place with her only child whom she supports entirely herself. Bestowed with at least seventeen years of experience, our client is a specialist in selling sacks of charcoal and firewood that she most frequently allows on credit for her customers via down payment; collecting the payments is done bit by bit each day. She has a large customer base composed of small-scale retailers and households in and around her area. Sacks of charcoal and wood are delivered to her home by wholesalers licensed for marketing forest products. 

After her sales, Mélanie no longer feels able to meet new customer orders. This is why she decided to renew her micro-loan for increasing her ability to stock up. Part of the extra revenues will be reinvested in her business to strengthen it, and the rest will enable her to support all her needs and those of her child, who was orphaned by the father. 

Mélanie is currently on her seventh loan at FINADEV.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal and a truck load of wood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds, urea fertilizer, herbicide and to recruit workers.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 62 years old and married to Annah. They have two children who attend school. He has been a farmer for the last eleven years. 
 
He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Gaetan

texts.en:
Gaetan is 30 years old and is married with two children who are 4 and 10 years old. He has owned a small business selling beans and sorghum for the past two years. His business is well organized and he works daily from 6am until 6pm every day except Saturday.

He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more beans and sorghum. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman. She is living with her husband and three children. Ten years ago, she established a tailoring business from her home. Her work is specialized in sewing pearls with textiles. She runs a business and at the same time, she helps her husband, who works as a farmer, with the household expenses. She is well known in her area, especially for her high-quality services she provides. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase textiles in order to increase her business productivity. In the future, she is hoping to open her own tailoring factory.

loans.use: to purchase textiles

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and to hire laborers.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 33 years old and married to Jeremiah. They have four school-going children. She has practiced farming for the last 10 years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her fifth loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor.

In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in her area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 32 years old, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for manual labour for hoeing.

loans.name: Samuel Street Group

texts.en:
Fanta is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fanta was born in Kabala town about 37 years ago. She is married to a student and the couple has four children. Fanta sells cotton cloths, coalman, bottle flasks, cooking pots, spoons, etc. Fanta has had more than 15 years of experience in business. 

With the help of this loan, Fanta and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Fanta will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cotton cloths, coalman, bottle flasks, cooking pots, spoons, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old. She is a widow with eight children. She has been doing a retail business for the past seven years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fifth loan from KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy cereals, maize meal and tomatoes to add to her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she plans to expand her business. Her hope is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy cereals, maize meal and tomatoes to add to her business.

loans.name: Assaad

texts.en: Assaad is a 33-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. He learned the mechanic occupation when he was very young. And after gaining the needed experience, he opened his own car repair shop in 2009. He is very talented at his work, which consists of repairing vehicle’s bodies.  With his requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will invest in purchasing new mechanical tools and supplies. He has a good business reputation and he is distinguished by his great customer service. His business needs many improvements and he notes that the loan will help him realize his intended objectives in a short term.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanical tools and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer, herbicides, and to pay for manual labour and hoeing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Tubula

texts.en:
Tubula is 33 years old, married and a father of three school-going children. He has been farming for the last 15 years.

He learned about KADET through a registered client. This is his first loan. He is planning to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to use the anticipated profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming.

His dream is do large-scale farming and attain financial independence.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer
